ULV-WT-du3HEEtaHkfJIzg.text: wow this is exactly as a cafe should be. in fact if I ever were to open a cafe, and I often have dreamt of it, this is exactly what i would have done.  charming decor, local artists on display, great music, free wifi, cozy tables, awesome staff, loose leaf tea, cool mugs, and a nice crowd.  love it!

ZuMDkr2eEDK-_2qmxl7okg.text: Given the only thing I've gotten here is various types of ice creams, this place is amazing. The service rocks and the prices are reasonable, while the atmosphere screams cozy coffeehouse. The T-shirts are pretty cool too, I love nothing more than to stop by here and get a desert after I get dinner at Boudreaux down the street :) Very nice and cozy.

G2uQqLHTqWEAypvsGRrd2A.text: I used to go in a lot with my friends last year, and always really enjoyed the shop! And now I hear, free wifi? Their drinks are awesome, their goodies are yummy, and some are gluten free! (Which means I can eat them! xD) They have really slushy ice, which is awesome because it is like snow, and I'm the weird kid who put out a bowl for snow to fall in every year so I could have 'natural' snow cones. The baristas are always friendly, and nice, even if you just want a cup of ice. I will definitely have to make my way over for some caffeine buzz, and free wifi to do my homework. Awesome shop with an even better atmosphere, definitely recommend it!

Pa33T0yrUbfsmyOcoNTcoQ.text: being a professional coffeesnob.  This made me happy.  Great service, the best cap in Charlotte, and a great place to hang out.  I went to all the coffeehouses in Charlotte this won!!

zJYVl6HKEyQS3i5ziLY6RA.text: Smelly Cat (or, Stinky Kitty, as I know it) is a great neighborhood coffee shop.  Small, semi-private booths, couches, and outdoor seating. Bring your dog, or your laptop, or your friend... or meet some folks when you get there!  Either way, great place in NoDa!

SR37u2URycZAhRyvIap5kA.text: Cool vibe, artsy neighborhood, good coffee. They offer 3 daily brews, including one flavored brew. The iced coffee is tasty, as well.

fm1hrT5_eS21nCpGNV0sAA.text: though i buy starbucks alot, i love these non-chain cute coffee-shops! decent selection of beverages.  i've only tried the iced mocha and it was good.  Wish I was in town a little longer so i could sit in the cafe and get some work done!

N5GoL509fozmaPfhHR9qQw.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my afternoon at Smelly Cat.  They've got all of the markings of the hip coffee shop experience: local artists' work as well as other types of quirky flair on the walls, little multicolored tables and chairs, just-off-mainstream but still pleasant music, thoughtfully planned nook/booth seating so you can sip your drink and work in your own private little world.  On the other hand, they also actually had friendly and helpful service, a welcome break to some previous hipster coffee shop experiences I've had in the past. I had a wonderfully refreshing iced tea and a slice of rich cheesecake, and I noticed that they also offer ice cream, all variety of espresso drinks and vegan treats (if you're into that kind of thing).  I do see how coming by at the wrong time could be a problem, what with the somewhat limited seating options, but I guess that's the price one pays for cozy.

SbyzpdKpOaG_tsHsnEXbJQ.text: Good coffee, but great location and atmosphere. A must in NoDa

Zy-FLWEnSInm0NhCeLvO4Q.text: Excellent independent coffee shop.  Hometown feel with NoDa culture.  Staff is friendly and the locals are interesting.  Good place to relax or have laid back business meeting.  Free Wifi and rocking chairs don't hurt either.

3CxUWECkZbldFhfpyJL8Bw.text: The atmosphere that Smelly Cat provides is a great additional experience to exploring the NODA area in Charlotte. I've been living in Charlotte for a year and this was my first experience of coming here. The coffee taste great, it gets crowded but doesn't feel suffocating, and the staff are really good. A place that I would definitely recommend if you're in the area. Enjoy Smelly Cat!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gather with your friends at Smelly Cat Coffee!
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smelly Cat is a stellar atmosphere! Go check it out for yourself!

fCD1BocYJfTCmHm6u0msyw.text: I'm in love with the mom and pop coffee stores popping up in Charlotte and smelly cat is one of my favorites. The shop is inviting and charming, but their coffee is amazing!   The cold press is perfect! No sugar or creamer is needed and the vanilla chai tea is to die for!!! They also have some tasty bakery goods. If you go on a early Saturday or Sunday morning you will be able to enjoy it right out of the oven. The zucchini bread is a favorite along with their morning glory bread-which contains cranberries, raisins, carrots and cinnamon!!!!

vBTNB8Y1Cp0nz7o2Kd3Cbw.text: So cute. I was in town with my boyfriend for the weekend and ended up in the NODA area for some food. We decided to walk around a little afterwards to look for some coffee and found this gem. It is a little standalone building with a creative logo that you can't miss! I would definitely see myself here often if I lived in the area. There is seating indoor and outdoor so it is a great little place to get some work done, enjoy some time to yourself, or have a chat with some friends while drinking some good coffee.

9HT13F7dZSEX2X7y3lhS1g.text: This coffee shop is so cute. I don't live in Charlotte anymore, but it's one of my favorite spots for whenever I'm back in town. Frozen dirty chai is amazing!

rgWmKnT7ochpq_lDBLXFEg.text: How can you not love a coffee shop named as a direct homage to the show Friends? Well, whatever they are feeding Smelly Cat, it must be fantastic! See what I did there?  Smelly Cat is well-placed in NoDa, and a perfect pit stop on the way to NoDa Eclectic Marketplace on Saturdays.Smelly Cat is pretty small inside, so getting a table can certainly be challenging and encountering a line is not an uncommon experience. But, that dirty chai though is well-worth the hassles.

J_1s0gkkpJ8JFiKvJPYQqg.text: What a fun enjoyable place to come to.  I came here one morning grabbed a coffee (which was delish) and muffin and sat outside (there is some great people watching which is an added bonus).

SqBt9CXAXl_ufbCpbwwAyQ.text: Smelly Cat Coffee is a cool little spot in one of Charlotte's "hip" spots called NODA. The interior of the place is equally as "hip". I've actually seen people hanging out here with their cats on a leash which I thought was pretty fitting. I would love to hang out here with my laptop and do some work but there is one thing that RUINS this place for me...   The coffee is terrible!  I am a bit of a coffee snob so take my review with a grain of salt. I don't drink lattes or frozen drink I like a plain cup of black coffee. I've been here twice and both times it was impossible to finish my cup of coffee because I was so bad. It's so bitter and acidic! I have yet to try a good cup of coffee here. It's comparable to gas station coffee, just a step above.  So go hang out here but don't get a cup of coffee.

c5CCO_3Fb8Sjn0WA_mDwOg.text: I absolutely love this quaint coffee shop. I've come here multiple times to work on papers for school and every staff member has been so friendly towards me. I asked if they would pour single glasses of wine and they gladly gave me a generous pour of some delicious red wine. I told them I was working on a big final paper and they asked me how I was doing with genuine curiosity. Totally recommend this place!

ijSA83KrF1t9_emEYRqBpw.text: I absolutely loved this little coffee shop in the Noda district of Charlotte. The space is a little tight but theres a great atmosphere here to make up for it and provide such a cozy coffee shop vibe! Outside seeing is available with some quirky art painted on the side of the building and some cute lights strung above the table area. Inside is set up with recycled materials and seemed like a nice place to set up a lap top and sit down and do work, but the weather was way to nice to not enjoy the outdoors and watch people walking to and from the farmers market. Their customer service was great too! If you seem quizzical in trying to make up your mind on what to order they are all there to help you decide! I ordered an iced hazelnut latte but was sad when i found out they don't carry hazelnut and the woman helped me find an even better flavor; toasted coconut! it was delicious and well made and kept me going all day! I am so happy that Noda had this little oasis to stop by that was a good break from brewery tours and pizza shops!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

psGok2TqWlo_apDuQrO3Fg.text: I think this is the best coffee shop in Charlotte. My personal favorite is their Vietnamese coffee (with a flavor shot), but everything I have ever had from there has been phenomenal. Their chai comes in at a VERY close second. Charming location. Great outdoor seating. They also offer a small menu of desserts, soups, etc. This place is a must stop every time we are in the area.

tKMNUyJk-FkotcHW0N_nsA.text: Not dog friendly as it says here. Did not allow me to bring my service animal into the shop. The cashier had us waiting in order to get a receipt, and there were people outside smoking weed. Originally it had a great feel but it overall was a bad experience. Definitely not Fido friendly.

Sprzz_p-C0dNkKqBxdN5fA.text: Super cute coffee shop with tasty beverages.  I'm no coffee connoisseur, but the coffee here is quite good.  I've been heading there to get a little work done on Sundays around midday, and there's a nice diverse crowd of people chatting, working, and grabbing to go drinks or food.  Cyclists stop by during the morning ride, and people walk their dogs up for a little morning caffeine. The atmosphere is very hipster and cool, but not oppressively so. Sunday mornings (I don't know what other days) they have hot breakfast items- biscuits, burritos and the like which are pretty good.  There is also a case of baked goods, but I haven't sampled those yet.  Overall, I will be returning for more coffee and chill time.

HvJlnWkQjMsMUaUAgSgnFQ.text: Good place to eat breakfast and get coffee. I especially like the sausage egg and cheese biscuits. I recommend to anyone to try this place because it's awesome.

mvZkQK-icWoArWr6WrNLTQ.text: Great coffee and I really love the ambience. I had the cortadito (Cuban coffee with a touch of foamed milk) and silly me I forgot to mix it up a little so the brown sugar ended up at the bottom of the cup! Still yummy, in spite of my operator error.

FB10AXSIKLKSxapg41pf3w.text: Love the chunky monkey, a frappe with a banana and chocolate blended in. So yummy!  The atmosphere is a True "coffee house" with great tunes and workstations with privacy and outlets.   A great noda treasure!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

tmiB0UOvUsYYHl-v-MG3vg.text: I can never have another Starbucks chai latte ever again after having one here. Trust me, I've tried.  Bummer since I just got on that train a few weeks ago.   The Smelly Cat has a short but delicious selection of lattes, frappes, and smoothies. Their chai latte had so much flavor I couldn't handle. I tried to drink a Starbucks chai latte a few days later but it now tastes watered down and lackluster.   The cafe itself is decorated with a collection of cat novelty items and other random trinkets. There is wifi and cute outside seating available as well.  I will definitely be stopping by again next time I'm in NoDa :)

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

mUWPGjSjRWoJuvymiIxVMg.text: Five stars for quality of coffee and service! Awesome coffee shop with high quality stuff and good prices

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

4liLxF6lTIT27-9qcRZ-jg.text: it was ok. I had to wait 20 minutes for my coffee because it was so busy and they only had 2 people working & then they gave my sisters coffee to somebody else so we had to wait another 5 minutes. It took way longer than it should have. The coffee however was very good. I got the chunky monkey frappe & it was amazing. The costumer service on the other hand was bad as the lady who worked there was rude to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. chunky monkey frappe

SAbpWG7diFBv6cXf5hJexQ.text: great atmosphere. nice and small and cute. not a lot of traffic coming in and out not noisy

4AxMEJ9a0YCRJdf-8fO5NQ.text: I will never forget you delicious iced chai! So good.   It's a fun and quirky coffee shop, that has delicious chai, what more can you ask for? Maybe a dirty chai, with a shot of espresso?? And pumpkin rolls in June? I'm in! Although I wasn't as into the roll as much as the chai, it's still a solid shop in my book.

E_uZ2SE4C1X-CiBw-AKhNA.text: Blackberry Frappe is my favorite but I tried their Cortadito Cubano today and it definitely gets my Hispanic stamp of approval!  I have no reservations about this shop. Great staff, helpful coffee tips for us noobs, great music, and a warm vibe that inspires creativity.

oJZGndZWx9gghXPQHAl76g.text: Love it here! We stumbled upon the place a few years ago while our friends were showing us around Noda and last month we were delighted to revisit. The coffee is gourmet deliciousness, the staff is knowledgeable and the decor is kitschy. Can't wait to go back.

zsTnRB5dEIE3ZOmjJPlIhA.text: If you like the ambience of a coffee shop than you will like this place.  The only minus is it very small so you won't be able to sit.  They roast their own coffee which in general is a plus for a shop. I had a white chocolate mocha and my girlfriend had a dirty chai latte both had great flavor. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves coffee it is worth your time! They also have stand up comedy which is cool but again it very had have 15 people in the place since it is so small.

avWSxkRWCL5l5YH8LxdqxQ.text: Smelly Cat C/H is in NoDa...and as the NoDa quest it is neighborly, and with an artsy flair. It is VERY tiny, and dark indoors, and there are a few tables & chairs outside. The 2 baristas, one male/one female, were both attentive, friendly & helpful in my choosing what to drink...it was my 1st visit there. The price of coffee was shockingly REASONALBE...YES! Smelly Cat was extremely CLEAN and tidy...something that is important to me. If I lived IN NoDa, I bet I'd become a 'regular' at The Cat. It's a good place to know about in that part of town to meet friends and clients, too. I only saw cookies/pastries to eat, but I was there in the evening and was more concerned with cleanliness than food choices (just being honest). I WILL return and use The Cat as a regular meeting place when in NoDa. Only possible 'con' is IF you use artificial sweetener, BRING YOUR OWN, as smelly cats do NOT use artificials...sorry but I have lived well on 'PINK" now 61 yrs and never treated even ONE patient in 38 yr of ER Medicine who was ill from using 'PINK'. I'll be stashing a few in my car starting now.

iKKQ4cgspokOOrzrZ9k3tA.text: The barista was very nice. The space is really cute. The tea latte I ended up with was tasty. And the price for it was very modest.  However, they were out of decaf espresso, so they couldn't make decaf coffee drinks. And despite the reviews talking about gluten-free treats, they didn't have any. So I was a bit disappointed.

b23c6HcafRXkrx8G8G4uQg.text: We stopped in here while in Noda and I loved the atmosphere of this place. It's dark and atmospheric, some place you could go to get work done. They have their roaster right out in the open which is awesome looking and the seating areas are separated by old doors. I had the hot chocolate and it was really great, super creamy and a good amount of chocolate.

VJ8IMXUx7tul_KD7-JtliQ.text: I walked in after work and was quickly soothed by Bob Marley tunes and a fresh Ethiopian Coffee.  There is reading material all around, which is definitely a must have.  The joint looks like a brick storage unit that was painted by a bunch of hippies and decorated by cat lovers.  There are comfy seats throughout and booths if you arrived with friends.    They change their coffee specials daily and they range from Decaf to Dark, and they are all delicious.  I heard the Mango Smoothies are a delicious treat as well.  I gotta try one next time around.    I also thought that the outside seating was well decorated with homemade wind chimes and trees for shade during those hot Charlotte afternoons.  I liked it so much that I should have left a tip at the bar, but I was a little broke.  Woops.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

QK0Q0cMNvw6NYr-owAGmXQ.text: Smelly Cat is a nice quaint little spot in the NoDa area. The Frappe I had there was absolutely delicious!

jSz4dkizWXg5x4R8_Eag1Q.text: Great place .. Good strong coffee . Was told by the girl at the counter everything g is made here -- even the coffee beans are roasted on the premises.

OR3fERB-JzlJSdxrqkmOsw.text: After being contacted by the owner through Yelp, I had to up my rating. This is my local coffee shop, and I thought I loved it before, my biggest complaint being they do not serve breakfast sandwiches.   Well not too long after writing my review the owner contacted me via message letting me know they have added B'fast wraps to the menu!! Stopped in to grab a bacon, egg & cheese and a Kona brew, and left a very happy camper.   This is the difference between local business and corporations, GOOD local business listen to the needs/wants of their consumer and adapt.   Kudos Smelly Cat, and thank you Cathy!

8meQrkEQ2yxncxsdw7ZwpQ.text: Great spot.My fav kind of coffee pub.went there this morning after show last night across the street at Neighborhood Theatre(another great venue!) Friendly staff.Great espresso.Fair pastry,but I didn't go there for the pastry! Next time I'm in Charlotte, I'll hit up the Cat!

HlQLLC-jugtr9fH_tlD7Dw.text: Tasty French Roast coffee? Super cool and friendly staff (this time)? AND not many hipsters clogging up the inside? Man oh man this is WAY more my speed.  I sat in a corner sipping my coffee (and guiltily chowing down on a cranberry muffin) and retaking in the place. Sure, the walls still had ears (and some overpriced artwork), but I actually could sit and think and write. Then about 30 minutes later, one of my friends dropped in and some of the stories she was telling I could tell the MacBook guy was listening quite intently.  While sitting in there, I heard The Decemberists, Temper Trap, and a bunch of other Leanne-approved alternative bands. Definitely an improvement of last time too.  Thank you Smelly Cat for a pleasant experience, I'll be back!  (oh yeah, and Props for the Yelp sign at the counter AND the one on the door!)

6zibjczPGuDhtZtNKqIVfg.text: This little coffee house is my favorite. The only place in Charlotte that offers a Cuban coffee or a Miami Cuban coffee, which are almost the exact same. Every time I am this part of town you will find me here, and always love introducing people to the cute coffee house. I wish I could give it more stars. The employees are outstanding and extremely nice. Love this place.

jjlbVy4TPlvb_Q1_OthBRQ.text: No Da at its best.  Small place, big prescences in the No Da hood.  Indoor and out door seating, plenty to eat and drink.  Parking can be a challenge, but when you want to get away from the Restaurant and bar scene in this part of town, Smelly is the way to go.  Be it coffee or tea, ice cream, or pastries, they have a little something for everyone.  During warmer months they also live music outside.  Throw in a Friday gallery art crawl and it is both a nice place to start and finish such an evening.

In038PHgcwPw7Dk8SAZLnA.text: Best coffee I've ever tasted! Being able to watch them roast the beans right in front of me was pretty cool as well.

LLstYW_lrQhK6uB5Sa0CBw.text: Smelly Cat has the best coffee in CLT. Hands down their Black Cat Blend and Triple Threat Espresso are the richest roasts, the most delightfully dark beans you'll get in the Queen City. This mind blowing coffee has always been fresh when I've stopped by for a pick me up and is served up by a friendly staff who are always warm and welcoming. It's a cute place too!

f_gv-NQQxzXMhKreN4TCoQ.text: This local coffee shop is the typical indie joint to grab a brew (coffee or beer). Every town has to have one, and Smelly Cat fits right into the Charlotte artsy district.  There is a lot of unique decor, it is located in a cool hipster district, and well... it is just totally what you expect! There are fresh baked goods offered, and alcohol, and lots of coffee choices. Also, there is ample comfortable seating and free wi-fi.  My decaf was pretty good, though slightly less hot than I would like. Regardless, the atmosphere is half of what makes a coffee shop great.  SC is friendly, and it is a solid place to sit down and enjoy your morning or afternoon with something to drink or eat. This joint really has the typical cool coffee shop thing down. Check it out if you want a hip, trendy place to bring your friends.

YPqT-vbwS6rL6z5acm4g9w.text: This is my favorite coffee shop by far. I love walking a few blocks to this cool atmosphere. Always friendly staff and the coffee hasn't been bad yet. Very fresh and satisfying. Have tried almost everything on their menu and have been impressed with the quality. Great prices and with the best coffee drinkers to hang out around.

Tb87vKNVZu2Ahe8yi3CxCA.text: Smelly Cat is a quaint little spot if you're in the noda area and are in the mood for some good coffee. I do with that they had more seating area since its often crowded during gallery crawls but otherwise its a great spot to chill with your friends and enjoy the noda vibe.

VfqjR3U1JlQXL_b9FPHD2g.text: Since they started roasting their own coffee, I take back my so-so review from before and give Smelly Cat a no-charity rating of 4 stars.

Z2ZpMIKVyfmdfIz2wgdDmQ.text: I've posted up at Smelly Cat a few times now for weekend work sessions and I've really enjoyed it. Their coffee is better than most that I've had in the city and their pastries are quite good as well. I've only ever been on the weekends but they get quite a bit of foot traffic here.   The baristas are very nice. It's a relatively standard set up with about 8 tables (three fun little alcoves) and one bar where sometimes people can sit and sometimes they have baristas using the Chemex. It can get crowded when everyone is standing around waiting for their drinks to be ready, but they work quickly. There is also some outdoor seating which is lovely, either on the sidewalk or the side of the building facing the parking lot. They always have music playing and I personally think they have good taste. My only complaint is the tables are a bit small (though admittedly, my laptop is enormous) and the AC is always WAY too high.   I will keep going back because I dig the ambience and the coffee ain't too shabby.

A5C4ogOys0XrCpUTnFg_IA.text: Wandered into this shop after landing in Charlotte at 7am. It was the only place open as I wandered NoDa, but I'm so glad I found my way to Smelly Cat. The dirty chai is the best I've had. So good, I went back the next day for the same thing. Plenty of outdoor seating when the weather's nice. Make sure to stop by on Saturday for the NoDa Farmer's Market!

MplRrWuEOOFEOW-jjUZiog.text: Best americano in Charlotte! The staff is fabulous at this cozy establishment. I had a Mediterranean quiche that was to die for the last time I popped in, and I always just get good all around good vibes here.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. The cutest! And, best coffee too!

DeI7TjsemY3L72-UVMhzIw.text: I came to this coffee house in NoDa just for its name. I love friends and wanted to try it just because. I was very surprised but the variety and the quality of coffee. The decor was unusual and unique and very cute. The price is normal , just like any latte. I got a almond mocha and a reg mocha and the total was about 10$ and change.

MEkKGQTXZPjVCVJUd33GSw.text: I fell in love with this coffee shop from the name itself, reminded me of how much I miss the TV show Friends.   I tried the Sledgehammer ($3.75)- espresso with Giradelli dark chocolate, it was pure happiness. Totally recommend if you like bitter coffee and dark chocolate. It's a little 4oz shot but I wish they served it in a big cup. The other coffee options looked great and interesting as well. They also have a few beers available in bottles.  It's a great place for a coffee date, chilling with friends and to study (FREE wifi, yay). It has both outdoor as well as indoor seating available. If I lived around, you would definitely see me here every week.  The servers are really friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend trying this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. The sign inside
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside of the coffee house
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

ZA_WsIWuje0FGc74LwYthQ.text: Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat,  What are they feeding you?  Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat,  It's not your fault   Now, I am going to be 110% honest here, the reason my fiance and I ventured to Smelly Cat is because we just moved to the area and WE LOVE Friends. When we found out there was a coffee shop in town and that's down the road from us named Smelly Cat, it was a no-brainer. So, we jumped on our bikes and the story beings.  WOW! Everyone and their Mom comes here. We visited Smelly Cat on a Sunday and I was nervous with the Farmer's Market next door and a number of dogs that we wouldn't be able to find a place to sit, but we did!   All of their breakfast items are homemade, so if you get there late don't be surprised if that breakfast burrito you wanted is no longer there. Yuuup, that's what happened to us. Our barista pointed us in the right direction and we settled for a breakfast sandy with sausage, egg and cheese. I am pretty sure the biscuit is what made this sandy from meh to yum!   Iced coffee lovers, this is your spot. With four, maybe five, different types of cold brew on draft. I don't see the problem. I went with the New Orleans style cold brew and I should have asked for more information. This was far too sweet for my likening, but now you know.

nKFMVYcPjJzeQn0WRhfWqw.text: The CUTEST coffee joint! We were staying downtown and I had never even heard of the NODA area. NODA is so cute- we decided we would stay in that area next time! Smelly cat had a cozy vibe and amazing coffee. We actually made another trip to Smelly Cat on our second day, as well, to get another coffee (cold brew for the win!). That time we were smart and got some coffee beans to take home with us. I recommend everyone check this place out.

Q8aQ71tzij5cC4cs9dITCg.text: I came here my first time and Charlotte and got their brown butter latte. I literally could not stop thinking about it and had to come back the next time I visited. Good coffee, fun homemade syurps, and an awesome vibe.

KO28p4RTLc992N0Yuqu8rw.text: I love this place, their frappes and coffee are so good!  Also, the location is right in the middle of NoDa & they have nice outdoor seating

PrdTNHkhe4dZXSnT7Hn3-g.text: Staff is friendly and coffee is delicious, what more can you ask for!?   Great spot to grab a coffee, sit out in the sun and relax.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

w3CwEibAm7N9WBjHzU9Htg.text: Excellent prices and excellent coffee. Not as gourmet a cup as what the coffee scientists at Hex coffee near Dilworth deliver, but still damn good. Also, the place itself and the area is really cool so consider a walk around if you aren't from Charlotte like me!

sqZZNi1NjNroSsBw5M9nEA.text: I went to breakfast at Smelly Cat Coffee with my boyfriend and we really enjoyed ourselves. We ordered a sausage, egg and cheese biscuit and a bacon, egg and cheese burrito. The burritos and biscuits are homemade but premade; if you come later in the morning the options may be limited and you made need to ask them to reheat your meal. The biscuit itself was outrageously good. The burrito was not particularly special, although the bacon was cooked nicely.  The coffee menu is extensive and clearly well thought-out. There are hot and cold preparations, as well as pour-over options. You can sample the coffees which helps with decision-making. My white chocolate mocha left much to be desired; it tasted like raspberry for some reason. The mocha flavor is why I docked a star, since it is a coffee shop after all!  Smelly Cat Coffee ROCKS the interior. You walk in and feel immediately transported to the hippest part of Brooklyn (or should I say "hipsterest"?). The ceilings are covered in burlap sacks for coffee beans, nooks are formed with reclaimed wood (each has an outlet so that you can utilize their free Wi-Fi), a giant old-school coffee grinder provides an amazing focal point, and the walls are even faux exposed brick. There is a LOT going on but it all works together to provide a clever and cohesive ambience perfect for weekend relaxing, weekday (small) meetings, or even grabbing a quick cup to-go. There is a darling porch area with outdoor seating options. Smelly Cat Coffee is extremely animal friendly.  We will be returning to Smelly Cat Coffee to try some new items. It would be great for a long, yummy Saturday morning with a crossword puzzle.

2SDD8icZwllvS0zCDeJipA.text: Second time coming here. They let me sample each cold brew and pick out the cold brew I enjoyed the most. The in-house one was up to par!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

Oks7u3aSj-JZeNLoKNPGvw.text: Great place to stop in and get a desert, this whole area is a very interesting vibe. Instead of being a bustling center it's more of an area you want to live by so u can WALK to ride a bike to. It's not so much a bar hopping things it's a neighborhood feel. Which I appreciate more than most, it encouraged me to stop there in the first place. When I arrived of course I noticed the fun decor but I also noticed that I was immediately welcomed. The staff went over the menu, at the time it was very hot outside so I decided to get one of their shakes, and one for my mom. She ordered an orange pop one which she said tasted just like the popsicle. My chocolate shake was okay, although it is general added for an extra flair, it had a slight taste of coffee to it. I've never been a big fan of mixing sweet with a stronger coffee tastE. I think it would have been fine without it. But overall a definite stop.

UpzH9WyPYIVc9W0HtyjSyg.text: My girlfriend and I's favorite place to start our weekend. Wonderful environment to sit and talk. The coffee stands apart from the rest and the people working there are fast and friendly.

Sairl7_Oo4gEdj70HEd03w.text: I got a spiced brown sugar latte and it was very good! Great service and got my drink super fast! Also the atmosphere is just so beautiful! So much detail everywhere!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

XDGMg3EgKJ4drC2oeJdMuw.text: Smelly Cat brings me joy.  Their coffee has never let me down. Hot fresh, roasty, toasty, creamy latte goodness.  Cute like a baby whose cheeks you want you squeeze.  Friendly like Labrador who wants to be petted behind his ears (sorry Kitty).  Perfectly located like a nose on your face (and in my favorite neighborhood).  A welcome beacon - a lighthouse that guides me to a caffeinated night cap before my journey home.  Gracias, mi amigo, Smelly Cat.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

1LThAM0mXvN96CK1RvNALw.text: We were just visiting Charlotte and this is where we chose to go for our last day's morning coffee.   Cute place, very popular, it appears.  At about 10 am Sunday morning, it was quite a line to wait to order.   I just got a coffee with almond milk and asked what vegan pastries they offered.   Disappointingly they only had one and it was not a choice I would normally have made, but I got their peanut butter bar anyway.   The young lady who served me identified herself as also vegan, so that made me happy, but spending over $9 for a medium coffee and a small peanut butter bar.   Otherwise, I like the place and might give them another chance when I get back to Charlotte, but I surely wish they would do more vegan pastries.  Matter of fact, how about ALL vegan pastries?!!!

dBwSQ_XfbFYNJJfgU8k7Kg.text: The best almond milk latte that I've ever had in my life. Creamy and smooth. The ambience and staff were perfection. I would fly from Palm Springs just for this coffee again! Sad to not spend more time here! You will not regret your visit here!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

lpSA1kjSPHOU6fyHUsEMFQ.text: Cute place in a great part of town. I know where I'm doing my exploring this weekend!  Coffee was great (I ordered a vanilla cappuccino).  While I was here I realized they also serve cocktails. Parking was the only issue I had with the place. There is a pay to park lot nearby but street parking and a short walk worked. Definitely worth checking out whether you're visiting or from the area.

Ox4cwy5owr4CQq9HQKT-Jg.text: Smelly Cat is an okay coffee shop. Maybe everyone else hyped it up to much and my high expectations weren't met, but after going there a couple times nothing really impressed me. Not to say that I ever had a bad experience. The staff has always been nice. The drinks are good, though sometimes they take a while to be made.  The inside of the shop feels a little cramped to me, but I am 6,2 so I could just be me. The interior is dim and comfortable, though they lack an of the nice big sofas some other Charlotte coffee shops have. The outside seating is sparse and the view isn't very impressive. There is some sore of "art?" garden outside that could be mistaken for trash.  All and all, you can get a good cup of coffee for you and a friend. It's not really the place for groups. If you are in NODA and need a caffeine fix, Smelly Cat is the place.

iCNqkSDOOetAa50CCzGrlQ.text: Great cup of coffee. Fresh roasted, service was quick and friendly.  Not much seating if you want to hang around there.

3-72tCbfoCdAMYyrl8zi4g.text: Very good cup of joe. Love the atmosphere here and prices aren't bad. Not sure if they serve food but if so its probably delicious

AzPAEoH2KGu328nXtq00IQ.text: This is my favorite coffee in Charlotte. It's usually easy to park, casual vibe. It's very hipstery, in a good way. They have a really pretty roaster, and I've seen them roasting their own coffee right on the premises. They have a baked goods, often began options, veggie chili, breakfast biscuits in the mornings. There is also a case that has a couple beer options. I can't think of anything else.

sLEQv_Sz4YFSV0tJUZHr4g.text: I love coffee...but more than that I love a unique atmosphere and supporting local businesses.  They make the best Chai...whether u get it iced or hot, in Charlotte. I have found myself waking up on a weekend and craving Smelly Cat...it truly makes the start of a nice weekend.  They have some bakery items for sale..but not a big selection;  I have tried the banana nut muffin and it's quite yummy. The staff is fun and I love that they use the Ipad when u check out...so tech savvy! I hope I can stop in sometime this week!

UoeYiTqD2kMbNq166vDcqw.text: Best dirty chai ever.  Excellent staff and a delicious beverages.  Just an overall enjoyable coffee experience.

vpCH4LYV2puDgrzd01CNlQ.text: I love Smelly Cat.  They are not only a coffee shop but a roaster as well.  If you can catch them on a roasting day, the smell is fabulous!  Kathy, the owner, is super friendly as is the rest of the staff and the coffee and pastries do not disappoint.  It's conveniently located in NoDa on the corner of N. Davidson and 36th.  If you're catching lunch at Boudreaux's or grabbing some beer at Salud, follow up with a locally roasted (usually organic) cup-a-joe at Smelly Cat.  Oh, and despite the name, there are no smelly cats anywhere to be seen.  This isn't a cat cafe.  Yes, those exist.

ajElczry_XIJnNUksak6JQ.text: This is one of my favorite spots in all of Charlotte. The coffee is great (especially since they started roasting themselves), and the staff is fun. They're also great with recommendations. Every now and then I just want to try something totally new, and everything they've recommended has been delicious.  The cuban coffee is a must, but they make the best soy dirty chai over ice that I have EVER had.

uYjX_IJDDSknbi3C_eMGAQ.text: I travel a lot for work, and everywhere I go, one of the things I search for is a local coffee roaster.  And there it is, sitting right in the front of a warm, cozy, welcoming shop. I had a pour over, which was measured, timed, etc all to the standard I expect of an excellent coffee shop.    What REALLY makes this place stand out, though, is their cold brew.  It was phenomenal, without a doubt, in the top three iced coffees I've ever had anywhere in this country.  Even black, it had a smooth, velvety creaminess, while still being refreshing and thirst quenching.   I have no idea how they do it.  I've had 24 hour brew. I've had Guatemala (where their current beans were from, I guess).  I've had cold brew that uses that same drip grind size. Nothing NOTHING has been as outstanding as what Smelly Cat puts out.  I'm simply blown away, still, a week later.  Otherwise, cafe space was clean, spacious, cute with mismatching chairs and tables, and a stack of board games. Folks were sitting both inside and out, and (gasp) conversing with each other instead of having their heads stuck in laptops.   The staff were beyond friendly, kind, and helpful in suggesting places to check out in the neighborhood.  If I'm ever back in Charlotte, I'll be at this place in a heartbeat to try their cortados, shots, and whatever else they can do.

uIgeGpE25Gm45dtTlsvtQQ.text: Best coffee  I have had , cute place, nice hard working staff, definitely will be going here often.

zzUDLfMXUCptjjiTzg1rNQ.text: Great cozy work spot, but very little in the way of food.  Just pastries and bagels.

9orBz9CcNxlVQwWeWpA1xQ.text: Smelly Cat was recommended by a friend, so my Wife and I are gave them a visit while we were in NODA. We like the fru-fru coffee drinks and usually go to Starbucks. I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. I had a almond milk mocha w/toasted coconut and it was probably the best cup of coffee I have had in quite a while. It was also a little cheaper than Starbucks. I will definately be visiting more often. Fresh Roasted Beans, a Nice Staff, and a Fair Price. I would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Nxj7vGtL5TPeG8RVn6RyUQ.text: Great area (NoDa). I'm a full time student, and this is an incredible place for me to come, kick back, and study for a little while. The coffee is delicious, though a bit overprices compared to some of the competition in the area.  Definitely recommend if you are wanting to try something new and unique.

XWTGFNhlnYGfw6QdAfI5oA.text: I've been coming here for years, I buy bags of beans, frappes, smoothies! Always delicious and always a pleasant experience! Nice cozy atmosphere with good tunes to listen to, bring your laptop or tab!! Toasted coconut frappe is my fave ;) had an instance or two where the beans were too dry, but still a very good brew

QYHDEJe4XRmWaNDXVkkRAA.text: Smeelllly cat, Smeeelllly cat, whaat aaare theey feeeeding yoou?  - in my Phoebe voice.    I always have the 'Smelly  Cat' song stuck in my head when I grab a cup of coffee here before breaking out my laptop to get some work done at this cozy shop. It's a good thing 'cause this place always perks me up.  Now, I'm going to spill the beans:  Pleasant pour-overs Freshly roasted coffeee Tip top tea (I like mine Green, aren't you envious ;-) Exellent Espressos (try the new Con-Panna) No bake brownie (nuff said) Friendly baristas Free Wi-Fi.  Plus, you gotta try the place out because it's a NoDa staple.

fa-f9ZeCu7NRlaMCQRcDIA.text: The "kegged" cold brew coffee is delicious! Especially if you like the flavor/texture of a good coffee stout.

qJFGYIjLU5wY2UR6o7mF7Q.text: Smelly Cat is busy as all hell, and while it makes enjoying the place a bit of a pain sometimes, you should also take it as a sign that it is not to be missed.  I travel to CLT a fair amount, and Smelly Cat is the only place that is on my must stop list of coffee houses in the city.

U7t3fEYoGv5LRJINJI9A8g.text: I love to support local coffee shops and Smelly Cat makes that really easy.  First, their coffee is great. They have a good selection daily of different brews.  I also like that they offer a daily flavored brew as well.  If your ever in the mood for something a little more mellow, but not a heavy as a flavored latte or mocha, a cup of Hazelnut coffee is the way to go.  I also like their strong sense of local-ism.  It is apparent that they want to support and encourage neighboring businesses.  Another major props to Smelly Cat for roasting their own beans.  This is really impressive and makes 36th Street smell AMAZING.    Finally, I really like the atmosphere of Smelly Cat.  They have great outdoor seating (with fresh water for my pup) and a really cozy layout inside.  Smelly Cat welcomes and encourages resting and relaxing over a great cup of coffee, a good book and free wifi!

EH15JjUsBNGNrax71LVCog.text: Visiting Charlotte and stopped here mainly because of the name. Very eclectic. Everyone was nice and friendly. The locals drew you into conversation. Right amount of quiet. We split a Apple cinnamon/cinnamon apple muffin that was moist and delicious. Coffee was great. They make their own with this up machine onsite. Would love to come back and just sit for a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Found the smelly Cat!
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Always!
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Muffins and other treats

2cLlPif6W3knRd3HYQhLmA.text: This is, so far, my favorite coffee shop in town. Comfy, good coffee, great prices and nice staff. I also like it that they work with Yelp because when I checked in I got a nice surprising discount just for checking in. I will be returning often and will also try catch some of the events they offer. The tomato soup is delicious! Too bad that there is not much seating inside, but it is not something to complain about as it provides an intimate atmosphere at the same time. Love it!!

lZBnNjqkez8o6AHF1qZfeA.text: If I have to spend some time in NODA, drink coffee, watch people, and work on my stuff on the internet/laptop, then this is the place.  NODA got some characteristics and this place completes the NODA neighborhood. The outside seating is not great if it's cold but in the warm weathers it's the best to sit outside, as long as the sun is not shining directly on you. Inside, the chairs and sofa chairs are comfortable. Few tables are setup in such a way that it feels like an intimate setup.   Main thing - the coffee is great. The barristas are friendly and helpful with any tips regarding coffee.  I am a big coffee drinker. If I am in NODA and have time for coffee then I know where to go.

xCFcPK7Bw4wi2B-Qq_CH-w.text: I visited this coffee house on two occasions during my last visit to Charlotte.  Conveniently placed in the commercial area of NoDa, this place features coffee roasted in-house. We didn't see much in the way of food beyond a few pastries, but I think the coffee makes up for that. I had a cafe au lait, with the dark roast (which I highly recommend). The flavor was robust and fresh, and the milk was scalded and not overly frothed in the cup, which is what one should expect with that order. My partner had a hazelnut latte, which he described as having light, airy foam that he felt was like sipping into a cloud.  The atmosphere was friendly and artsy. We had the choice of sitting inside or outside, and frankly, we did both.  The inside has outlets at every table for customers bringing laptops, and there are a few benches and tables outside as well.  We will definitely return when we come back to Charlotte to see this place develop!

YatkyHtxRl_hCLeSgG9epQ.text: In the midst of Charlotte's lackluster coffee scene, Smelly Cat stands out as one of the best. Their iced coffee is delicious, and the setting is always a great place to work. I've written many a college paper there.

unoeW0NDpTzedwRq3fpKbA.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I moved to Charlotte 3 1/2 years ago from Illinois. I don't know why it's taken me 3 1/2 years to find a wonderful coffee shop but HOT DAMN I found one! My coworker and I got frape's today - I got a coconut frape and she got a peanut butter frape. My life is changed. I have seen the coffee heavens with my own eyes through this coffee. Thank you to whomever opened this store and thank you for making delicious coffee. I am so happy I can now support a local coffee business instead of being disappointed at the big-box coffee shops. Thanks again - I'll be a regular customer any time I'm in NoDa.

-OAWE144I5c1mfA6aDbvvQ.text: Great coffee, great service and nice environment.  Must try the Dirty Chai, pour over coffee and peanut butter bar is to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

Vgn4k0LVhc8yJgOhQgjzlw.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Charlotte! Best mocha frapp I've ever had. Love, love, love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smelly Cat

PFgrKhm2vj9veSzzBp54yw.text: Pretty good ! Rated 4 stars instead of 5 just because I reserve 5 stars for the absolute best places. I love their coconut iced lattes. They never get the whipped cream right. Parking is hit or miss. Really cute atmosphere in and outside.

PBOg3v6z5_i7lhYGEyPUUA.text: The coffee is unique, that's for sure. I visited here from the airport due to a caffeine headache, and sipped at my coffee as I traveled the two hours to Asheville. While I was there I tried other coffee shops, but I really missed the stuff I got here. On my way to the airport I stopped by here to grab another coffee and a bag of their beans. They have a giant in house roaster, so I got beans that were freshly roasted that day! They also support the local businesses in the area, so I'm a fan. The workers weren't exactly friendly, but for the good coffee it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. The outside at night.

2OhnNPh2Gviulqf7kKPSaQ.text: Love the vibe of this place. Never been disappointed except with parking options.  Coffee is delicious and the atmosphere is inviting.

J6ktboK8Be4BZfgrrehlCg.text: Friendly people, easy parking. I just got a tea, so I can't vouch for hand crafted drinks, but I'd go back.

HCl4DPvsO-By2MM1jB3G8Q.text: Excellent coffee house!  I had espresso (latte) which was wonderful....not bitter at all!   I hate Starbucks and coming here and experiencing a real coffee shop where there is a quality product was awesome!   We need more of these places in Charlotte!   My hubby had Cafe au lait which he said was delicious and he's not even a huge coffee person.   The ambience of the place is great to hang out in and just chill or enjoy with friends!

IEHc8Vex_4oVJ8IpYufZXA.text: I recently moved to Charlotte and I have been looking for a local coffee shop with a homey and relaxing feel. Smelly cat is exactly that! It has a cool outside seating area to hang out with friends, a nice inside area to hang as well. I'm really liking the decor too. I wish there was a little more seating inside though. Really friendly staff too!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan Chili sample, I don&#39;t eat chili, nor am I Vegan, but AMAZING!

1BHTu3N3ahmekXsDEUhMog.text: I went here with my aunt who I am visiting. She had been raving about it for a while. I was pleasantly surprised by the cute decoration on the outside and all the outdoor seating. It was around dusk when we went so all the outdoor lights were on as well which added to the ambiance.   The inside did not disappoint either. It had the neatest seating made from reused doors as well as regular tables. It was very cozy and private.   The menu was diverse and they had a few little food items wrapped up for sale. I had a regular coffee and my aunt had a orange creamsicle milkshake. Both were very good.   The service was efficient and fast. It was quiet and a great place to enjoy a book. I enjoyed this local little coffee shop and will for sure come back. A great little place to check out in NoDa!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of the lights that were strung outside in the seating area.
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside of the coffee house. You can see the neat door decor.

J2fdTroCjd29Y2XjZyg0wA.text: Smelly Cat is my new jam. Many reasons behind this, but number one amongst them is THEY ROAST THEIR OWN COFFEE. I haven't non-single brew coffee this good since SoCal. And believe me, freshly roasted coffee is seriously good. Earthier, smoother, more flavorful.  But the coffee is not the only reason you should visit Smelly Cat. They carry first-rate snacks from premium local bakers, including some incredible gluten free options. I sprang for the gluten free peanut butter brownie and OMFG was it good.  There's also an awesome patio area in the front where you can hipster-watch in NoDa. Those hilarious hipsters, always up to some sort of hullabaloo or haberdashery.  You should go to Smelly Cat for all of these reasons. I look forward to exploring their shop again.

nJB3_nuM9m5Yk5-9isYk5A.text: Awesome and friendly staff, helped me pick a great drink and taste some of the cold brews they had. Next time I am in Charlotte I will go again.

OKDa_2BJLv-XGcz245xxyA.text: Great Dirty Chi and funky atmosphere. The Hubbs and I drive from 25 min away just to get a coffee and hang out. Worth a little drive.

gLUYsWmiSzSRY6dYJmeEng.text: Although I have been to NoDa several times in the past, today was my first time going to Smelly Cat. I had a great first experience there and definitely recommend stopping by if you're ever in the area! It's cozy, quirky and even has outdoor seating.   They have awesome service, and everyone there was so friendly. My friend and I met all the workers on a first name basis and even met Cathy, the owner who is such a sweet lady by the way. They made me feel like I was a regular customer!  There were numerous drinks on the menu but not many pastry choices, which is why I did not give it five stars. By suggestion, I ordered an iced dirty chai in the biggest size they had. It usually comes with four shots of espresso, but I asked for one less shot. I thought it was delicious-- and this is coming from someone who is not so fond of the chai-taste!

7M4AGYsdaswuG2aUYn17Fw.text: When I first moved to Charlotte I did not know about NoDa, so when 55 scoped this place out he told me I would like it.  He was correct!  This is a cool place with cool customers and Cools as customers which is important in this particular situation!  I like the Espresso and I like the Hot Chocolate even more!  The Staff is always very friendly and have always been successful in making something good for me!  The inside of this place is as cool as the patrons who like hanging out here.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

wnvnslnIX6NmX6BuZqCkDA.text: Good cafe.  Great area and vibe.  Too bad they sold out of my size of t-shirt.  Oh yeah, the coffee was excellent.  Had the sweeten sled New Orleans iced and it was superb.

NryT4ZUWXUN7_CjHGOlW-g.text: By far my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte! The service is typically always quick, the coffee is amazing and they'll actually take the time to explain a drink to you if you're not sure. Their pastries and breakfast sandwiches are delicious and I haven't even mentioned the coffee yet! Roasted in house this is by far some of the freshest you will find in the area, do yourself a favor and pick a bag up to take home!

38uX0UsfvdkGYXfX5Zj0MQ.text: Great coffee and funny name. When you bring your own travel mug, they give you a 10c token to place in one of multiple buckets hanging on the wall, each one representing a different charity. Cool concept!

vzY77qbaE7-t0p8n8icIcA.text: Okay yes they didn't have a burrito for breakfast but at least the biscuits were really good! The place is tiny but great and the coffee very unique and nothing like Starbucks.   Worth the trip to see the artwork and catch the great vibes of NODA . I can see why this place is a local favorite. Plus who can't stop thinking about Friends when they hear this name! I like it because it is an experience. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit egg cheese and bacon

6mbtUrvTnoJGRz2Ip6a5nA.text: While visiting mom in Charlotte found this great place for good coffee and breakfast... was attracted to it by name back in the days of Friends Show. Glad I found it!

MOi5faITlSo0-2_jPMARBA.text: This was my first visit to this famous NoDa neighborhood coffee shop. Following most Yelper's recommendation, I tried the hot 'dirty chai' and definitely enjoyed it, although it didn't leave me jumping for joy. It came in a really small cup, maybe 10 ounces ( which is okay with me) Maybe I should try it iced? Not sure.   The restaurant itself is a unique, quirky , funky type of place that would like to park myself in to read a book, do some homework, or write some Yelp reviews.  It's very narrow inside, but they got creative with the seating: single person alcoves along the wall, bar seating at the front window, seating outside in the front, and on the sides of the building. There is even a curvy bar from which I believe at some point in the day they serve beer on tap ( local brewery creations included).   Saturday morning was pretty crowded inside, but I will certainly be making a trip back, maybe when it's not so busy.

U5XgdKmzC_du289nTlT8ew.text: We stopped in here for a quick pick me up. I ordered an iced coffee & my husband ordered an iced tea & blueberry muffin. It was a cute little coffee shop, very unique.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Iced coffee, iced tea &amp; blueberry muffin
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sign
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

Bl7VHgJthoONt1gjLnIJDA.text: One of my personal favorite coffee shops in Charlotte. Located in the heart of NoDa, parking can be a little tricky--but they do have a small lot next to the building.  It's a quirky joint in everything from it's name to its interior design, and it attracts all kinds of customers. I think we all have a universal appreciation for the "Friends" love.   The coffee is great, they have multiple options to choose from and they have baked goods and breakfast options to enjoy with your drink!   I recommend sticking to the basics: black coffee with a bacon, egg and cheese biscuit sandwich, you won't regret it!

5-eoV39bada6_JtnpfusMQ.text: I love the Smelly Cat's Americano! I have found it tough to find a properly extracted shot of espresso in Charlotte but the Smelly Cat definitely impressed me! Great job!

hToqrhge9PzNgBbhck8TqA.text: Best Parts 1. High quality coffee 2. Best biscuits in town 3. Nice ambience inside and many chairs to use outside the shop. Cool place to hang out for coffee date or chat with friends  4. Convenient varieties of coffee and chai  Bad parts 1. Minimal parking spots 2. Only bottle beers available

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

1Rj9wjIBoLf3WVZiK6xptw.text: Wow, amazing Chai, creamy and just the right amount of sweet, defiently come here! The staff was also very welcoming and such a joy to have a conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

kG-IKT1Cg7BSdZQBEpgmxw.text: This place is small but super cute. I had the frappe and it was incredible. My boyfriend had just a coffee and he said it was ok. Parking isn't too bad. They have food too.

AweXw_XRZExWzw0K3EowHQ.text: This place was amazing! I honestly wanted to try it out because my sisters are hugely obsessed with FRIENDS and it reminded me of the song they always sang from the show. The coffee was fantastic. The people were friendly and helpful. The biscuit sandwich was so amazing! Only thing is limited inside seating. But it's a coffee shop so I'd expect that! Definitely need to go make it a regular stop!

i-d2nacdyH6oSKmoeyAjDw.text: Hands down Charlotte's best dirty chai. Good vibes in here! One of my most fav places to get coffee here in the Queen City, located right in rad noda. Grab a coffee - chill inside, or go walk around and get weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

0Ndkbsrulkhix2oNvhPmMg.text: I'm obsessed with this place. The line is crazy long on a weekend morning but worth it -- we snagged a small table in the cute, cozy shop. I had some incredible pour over. My friends latte was solid. The food looked delicious and they even have beer and booch on tap. Cute little patio where you can sit with your pup. But I love being indoors to enjoy the kitschy cat decor.

G0aGcJJbx7T4ieBPpC3GDQ.text: I had heard really great thing about this place so I was really excited to go this morning. However want a desappointement... I order a bacon egg and cheese biscuit (seeing that they say they make it fresh from scratch everyday) and my husband got a burrito. We received 2 items wrapped in foil like you would get maybe at a Taco Bell or some fast food and it definitely tasted like it.  Food had definitely been nuked in the microwave, it was so bad that I am going to have somewhere else to get something to eat after already paying for food. As for coffee, we ordered a cortado... it wasn't too bad but it wasn't good either. Don't recommend with better option in the area.

-N1YPdHsyOPyq3-tzLJXdA.text: Coffee is soooo good here! I know to bring any of my friends or family who come to Charlotte to this coffee place!!they have so much history and it's so good!! I thought it was so funny ho she gave me the character Monica to find my table since my names Monica

swdgVPcSgEHg6pzaGQuGjw.text: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! The staff was great and made some awesome recommendations. It was a great, cozy, coffee shop kind of vibe. The kind of vibe where you're just hanging out and lose complete track of time. I truly enjoyed my time there and can't wait to go back!

2m8BwuAm8Zxy5eFi1PD1CQ.text: I've never liked coffee... it tastes weird to me and I always need a crazy amount of sugar and creamer and just about everything else to make it decent, not even good. This coffee however was phenomenal, I was so thrilled. The vanilla latte with almond milk rocked my world and even though it's nearly an hour drive away from my house I will be returning to get a large cup this time instead of a small, I recommend this place to anyone visiting the Charlotte area!!!

RLQGo1bRIB3TbFxcaRVepw.text: Maybe it's just me, but the unsweetened cold brew is the worst I've ever had. What I like about cold brew is that it's so smooth, you can drink it without any additions. But this! It had such an overwhelming, overpowering caramel flavor that I could hardly choke it down.   That same visit, my pregnant friend wanted an iced drink. The smallest you can get in iced is a medium. She couldn't have that much caffeine, so she asked for less espresso for the same price. They wouldn't do it. Something about how the machine pulls the shots. Come on now. You can't accommodate your pregnant customer on a 100 degree day?

qIcO4UR-fsNhSx1tvsjeXw.text: Very cool place. Iced mocha latte was delish! Cool neighborhood to walk around and check out.

Hts-trIikqw1Jx2_8ukPdQ.text: Awesome staff!!!!! We were traveling through. They gave me tasting of a few coffee types since I usually only drink tea but when in Rome. I found a delicious one! They make all breakfast items in house. We had quiche and egg/cheese burrito yummy. We also got coffee cake muffins and water for the road. The atmosphere is eclectic and groovy. A must see. If your traveling through make the effort to hop off I-85 and enjoy it. You will not be disappointed. They have outside seating also. A small parking area on each side of building and street parking. Did I say awesome staff oh yeah but I'm sayin it again! Great job guys. GROOT loves you!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Traveling GROOT
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee bean bags make up the ceiling
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

XHyYsHqUNCblD692er2npg.text: Entered Smelly Cat for the second time in my life the other day (first visit was a group meeting back when I was getting my MBA, and I'm trying to block that craziness from my mind, so this review is only for my most recent visit).   What a wonderful little coffee shop. If I lived in NoDa, I would definitely support this small business instead of hitting up the big chains. The atmosphere is quite cool and laid back, and the staff was beyond wonderful. They had a ton of pastries and what looked like a mouth watering carrot cake, but I was there for one reason, and one reason only...caffeine.  Nicole W (being the fantastic community manager that she is) raved to me about the pour over coffee, so at Yelp's Passport to NoDa event earlier this week, I hightailed it over there to check it out. The wonderful Cathy (what a great name, huh?) walked us through the process of pour over coffee, which creates a very smooth cup o' joe. I thoroughly enjoyed the lesson and my caffeine - with some steamed almond milk and honey. Very, very good. If you have the time to wait, I highly recommend checking it out.   And to support the business even further, I purchased a nice little pullover. There are t-shirts, sweatshirts, and other items for sale with the logo and location on them. I love me some quirky little gear.   Head on in to Smelly Cat and sit inside if the weather isn't good, or grab one of the outdoor tables and soak up some vitamin D. Either way, you can feel good about supporting a small business in your area.

MkIi3ud2Vx4QpYRKbUKVIA.text: This is one of the best coffee shops in Charlotte! I have been going to Smelly Cat since 2012, and I keep going back there at least once a week. The baristas are always friendly and they have a great sense of humor, the atmosphere is great, it is beautifully decorated, and the coffee is amazing!

bfDm3atvW4Cq681X8hq2UQ.text: Michelle and Allison are the dream team baristas! Best iced white mocha in Charlotte.

AIkB2Dm1QNg9bAhUej197g.text: First off, I'm fully in support of independent coffee shops. I won't lie: I love Starbucks for its consistency and quality drinks. But sometimes you just need to leave the corporate behind and support local businesses.   I wanted to love Smelly Cat--I really did. (Come on, what's not to love about the name?) And from all the good reviews, I had high expectations. I don't at all consider myself a snob, but it just wasn't my scene. Rustic is nice, but Smelly Cat could have stepped up the decor just a tad.   The coffee house reminded me of a dive bar. That's not a terrible thing though, right? So, my impression was that I'd at least get a reasonably priced drink. However, I was taken back to find out that a small flavored iced latte would cost me $5.  Whoa...I didn't realize that ice cubes were that hot of a commodity in Charlotte. So I immediately backtracked my order and went with a frappe instead. It tasted alright, though it was on the rich side.  I will give Smelly Cat a thumbs up though for its indoor and outdoor seating. There's definitely plenty of space to chill out and enjoy your food and beverages. Oh, and did I mention they sell beer? I didn't try it, but kudos for that.

dTjS8DPz2jsgnjUaACS0wA.text: Posting for a friend (because I'm a Smelly Cat fan and want to support these guys!) "I had not gone into Smelly Cat for over a year because I experienced extremely rude customer service. Despite my past experience, I decided to give Smelly Cat another try. Last Sunday, I went in and the staff was extremely personable! Best customer service since Leah left! I will gladly continue to enjoy this place in the future!"

o0Kh5dqBzjT4lg1nVzXBLg.text: We went here after KIDaween at The Neighborhood Theater this past weekend and I've been here once before several months ago. It's a pretty cool place with a lot of personality. The coffee is good, I just had a regular, dark roast coffee and Becky had tea. KIDaween gave each one of The Little Kids a coupon for free ice cream which we redeemed.  The staff was awesome, friendly and professional. The girls at the counter were very nice to the kids and asked about KIDaween.  The set up is quaint and artsy as it should be in NoDa and there's a nice balance of NoDa natives and families filling the tables.  Love the community board (but I have a weird thing for those) and the little outside area.  Definitely will stop by again.

9Xri9vmHUmp2qdgf2AlRZA.text: Couldn't find a singing Phoebe Buffay, but I did find some friendly folks and coffee sooooo good it'll make you watch Friends re-runs!

R4NBw27845WN1vN41huHJQ.text: This has to be my favorite coffee house in Charlotte.  The atmosphere is eclectic and inviting.  The place has a lot of older type couches and chairs which also make it unique.  As far as the coffee itself goes, it is always strong and fresh.  I have had espresso drinks and just regular brewed coffee and all of the drinks have been made perfectly.  I wish I lived a little closer, as I would visit more often.  If you want a coffee shop that is off the beaten path, give this place a try.

x4ucuf17NNfJb0YweKVahQ.text: Great hot chocolate and cortados. Needs better signage. A little small if you were hoping to sit down and enjoy your drink on a cold day, but there is some seating if you get there early.

ZnNxWSlYfe_0inGdtAQExw.text: Smelly Cat features free wifi and friendly service. One of my favorite spots for an afternoon coffee and a laid back atmosphere!

OX5-NfMnCE4sAfttK99jvA.text: Nice, querky stop along the way. Like others have posted earlier, it definitely is eclectic, artsy, and independent. It has good energy, draws a good crowd. Music adds to the chill atmosphere too.  I guess they are pretty open on allowing pets in because a patron brought her dog in with her. The bathroom was clean...always a plus.  I'll be back!

PJPgojmMsJb5iYP9t649XA.text: Love the cat! The coffee is tasty, good variety of pastries, and the baristas are friendly.  In the summer I recommend the iced coffee. You can have plain or flavored iced coffee and the ice is slushy (like Sonic or Chickfila) so it's a nice surprise if you're used to the cubes at Starbucks or Dunkin.  Definitely sign up for a VIP account if you'll be stopping here often or you're social media savvy. Smelly Cat rewards it's VIPs with special treats (check Facebook or Twitter for postings) and with each purchase you earn other rewards like free coffees. I really love a place that loves it's customers like Smelly Cat does.

J-4r2xsR_BBZN6F-6y0fIg.text: Great locally roasted coffee.   Convenient to UNC Charlotte.  Friendly, coffee savvy staff.

MT9HOgyYx2bGWOJ6MSRtmA.text: Maybe a take out of Friends the TV show yet this is a TRUE coffee house! Nestled in the artsy part of Charlotte called Noda, this place embodies what an independent coffee house should be like. Great coffee and atmosphere!  I will be back many times.

a4-AqkUB6XVVeeFpBSS9xQ.text: Iced white coconut mocha. Yum! Hubby had blended spiced brown sugar caramel latte.  Delicious.  I'll come every time I'm in Charlotte!!

KpRqd-PyLZWtCrX10zumlA.text: Neat decor, cool booth ish places and pretty solid coffee. I didn't watch friends so I don't really get the name but i like it anyways.

4zSnHd9EH9uCC9iPDVSOcw.text: Don't let the name fool you, they have great coffee all around.  And they have soy milk for non-dairy people.  Very cozy atmosphere.  Cool booths made out of antique doors.  A down home kitchen feel but equally appropriate for coffee snobs who would like to go somewhere besides Starbucks for a change.  Not that I have anything against Starbucks, but I'm looking forward to visiting Smelly Cat again.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smelly Cat Storefront

_D4F2aSZRtRRd-3_t6VS6w.text: With a name like Smelly Cat, I have to admit I wasn't really sure if it'd be that good, but I decided to give it a try for the sake of Friends. It's a cute little place with a sweet outdoor area and decorated with its namesake animal, cats (but not smelly). I love the fact that they roast their own coffee and that there was a coffee roaster in the shop itself.  I decided to try a Vietnamese cold brew coffee out of curiosity since I've never seen that offered anywhere else, and it was delicious and served over crushed ice. My bf got a medium roast coffee and said it was pretty good too.   Friendly barista, cute coffee shop, delicious coffee with CRUSHED ICE--all reasons why I will make a point to come back here whenever I'm in Charlotte next.

f56yaKTqq4xKup9nOvGVMQ.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte. The atmosphere is fantastic, the coffee is always good and you just never know who you're going to run into. ALL the staff is accommodating, helpful and friendly. If you've not been, you are missing out on one of the Queen City's best kept secrets!

6QiDicDn2lCrKd5ORKCDDQ.text: Great , friendly atmosphere. They brewed a pour over I requested , excellent!   Best coffee I've had in Chatlotte. They roast the coffee in the shop.

AJqOj4JFMymDlnVLPsTkUQ.text: Came looking for a good local coffee shop and this place delivered. The place is kinda small so come at a good time and you'll get a seat--but I have no complains about the quality of the coffee. The atmosphere is very relaxing and NoDa (the area it's located in) is a nice spot as well! A good central location and now my local favorite.

YH_8pKAbOYxqd-0LpHoGLA.text: The llorona cold brew with heavy cream is one of the best cold brews I have ever had. I have drank a.lot of different coffees from across the USA and Smelly Cat stands out as one of the best.

53qMZqpLAHSiga-r86CxIA.text: A good weather calls for a good cup of coffee ..  Enjoying my cortado with a very fine company !   This place offers good ambience and good music with great coffee.  Also, I bought my first smelly cat coffee mug today :D

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cortado and cappuccino with my first smelly cat coffee mug in the brown bag

hOUuVU0dPcN4L2Cd8pS6yw.text: Great place to work or study. Good coffee, tea, and beer selection.   Can get a little crowded at times, but clears out quickly.  Accessible parking in their lot. If parking lot is full, you can find parking on the street easily.

MITJ9M3ik16l4JJ8VfB_CA.text: Quaint and cozy coffee shop with friendly staff. Coffee was tasted great and they had a small selection of pastries/muffins. Great outdoor space too. This place has a great vibe about it.

VpeF-a58dPFn66iETcAyAg.text: A great place to get coffee in NoDa. The staff is always so friendly & they have the best hot chocolate. The set up inside is pretty cute too. There's always a lot of seating outside as well.

1o4m-DXgbnRHXDcASGiMoQ.text: Funky little place. Been driving by here for ever and always wanted to stop. Friendly staff, typical coffeehouse menu. Got the toasted coconut frappe. YUMMO!! I'll have to stop in more often.

mbRtNBfNv6_XHlSwNJSevg.text: Great coffee shop.  Service was quick and friendly.  Coffee was great.  The space is a little tight and we ended up sitting outside.  Highly recommend and we'll visit again.

v6DAAmx4wzekavm9yC2nQw.text: I love this little place with all my soul. Super cute. Super quaint. Personalized and hipster fresh. Ordered the toasted coconut latte. Yum! House made syrups! Yum! Place is kinda small and it's a little cold to utilize the outdoor seating but I could totally see myself coming to this place everything to retreat. I'm not from charlotte but of the 4 shops I've tried while I've been visiting, this by far is my fav. If you love super unique places. Try it!

Bn4kDTAlCjHUTYyblkb2EQ.text: Awesome little coffee shop with beautiful design. The mural in the bathroom is beautiful!  I had a dirty chai frappe... Delish!!!!  Can't wait to try it again, next trip to Charlotte!  Best name for a coffee shop too, totally reminded me of a much cooler Friends Central Perk :)

_MmTWfMQjiEaz4OqBWwfzQ.text: Smelly cat stinks. The espresso was horrible and borderline undrinkable. However I did hold out hope for the bag of beans I purchased. There was no information on the bag regarding roast level and region / location of the beans. As soon as I opened the bag I realized I shouldn't of purchased. The beans were burnt or to be generous a very dark roast. If you are passing through like I was skip this place and go to ANY other coffee shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Worst bag of coffee I&#39;ve ever purchased.

IWhuRJ331l0tbnu-l-B37A.text: What a great find while passing through town! Amazing coffee (they even have Cuban coffee, as well as cold brew on tap) and a super friendly staff. I would love to find more coffee shops like this around the US.   I will definitely be going back here whenever possible.

Rt_rCRfxz9TivdZwtKyLZA.text: In town visiting and found this cute local place. Hands down very iced coffee I've ever had. Strongly recommend the Vietnemese Blend. And wow was it strong. Don't drink on an empty stomach! Employees were super nice and welcoming.

kG1UTTjEj4WVIfXDcy7wQA.text: Pricey, but so good. I love love love the friends theme and I worked from there last week. It was nice to just be out of the office in a great coffee shop
