nParHJo6UGVw6m3HCZ0Z5A.text: Worst service ever!!! Was really surprised to say the least. The young lady at the cash register was rude unwilling to correct the order. Whatever you do do not expect to get a real Cuban cafe I tried to explain that what they were serving was not a Cuban cafe she became insulting to my culture as I just wanted to exchange the cafe to something else needless to say I will not go back if that's how they treat customers I went during evening hours and I will not suggest anyone else does that's looking for a Cuban cafe but hey if you want a bad attitude, and terrible service then this is the place for you

1fudlu932bFN7-JIlktp7g.text: Got a nonfat latte with 1/4 of toasted coconut - delicious! Went with the suggestion of a BES biscuit, also very good. Reasonably priced & cool vibes, even for a 50 something.

SavaemSNIE8vdw6mq-qlAg.text: My almond milk coconut latte tasted the most like a real latte I have had in a long time! The cashier was helpful and the atmosphere was chill.

p0vyeXFwIvsHXfb2h7VM8A.text: Their coffee is good. However.  Asked for a top off and they wanted to charge me for another full cup. This is bad business. You have a 160z cup as a large size with no option for larger. Many people drink 20 to 24oz. There is no question they are losing potential business with this ill-advised policy. Also. Kind of interesting claiming to be an eclectic coffee shop in the heart of NODA while gouging people at the same time. What irony and hypocrisy

IujiuSDwZKFoxowk8f07QQ.text: This is our first time here and we had two fantastic almond milk lattes. Breakfast burrito was also good. Most of all the place is just a great coffee house atmosphere - - comfortable inviting... Just an overall good vibe!

Ise7Vj4h9HThnMt12WRcog.text: This is a pretty weak excuse for a coffee shop. Even the name of the place is an embarrassment if you ask me. I suppose that they are fans of the show Friends? Menu is unoriginal and over price. The place is a weak imitation of Starbucks; and a rude staff as well! Do not waste your time or money at Smelly Cat.

ttYOq4gZIijSI6QIvYKQtA.text: Smelly Cat is a decent coffee shop. The main thing it has going for it is the ambiance, it is a very nice spot. The coffee is good, nothing to rave about. I would give Smelly Cat a better review if they had a better food selection, though their muffins are my favorite it isnt enough.

obwiCPoDHAOtF0EYudfaaA.text: I'm from Chicago in Charlotte area for an internship. I google 'best hot chocolate in Charlotte' and Smelly Cat pops up. I gotta say they were right. It is the best hot chocolate I've ever had and I came back to try the Chai cause they told me it was good. And it was just as good as the hot chocolate. Before I go back home, I'll be stopping in for some hot chocolate and some chai to take home with me.

7pWKyVGpMc4m3hBmfPIA_g.text: I wish I liked this place better than I do. Coffee is just ok and it always takes forever to get my coffee, no matter how busy or not busy it us. There always seems to be a conversation going on with the barista and a local that distracts from my service. That said; the place is cute with only a few tables and a small outdoor area. But I guess if you live in NoDa and you need your coffee fix and Amelie's is not an option...here you go.

IokCqkoOLn0Pf6vXM0MTBA.text: The Smelly Cat was great. They have a very bright and fun decor; outside seating; and a big set of rocking chairs. How can you go wrong with rocking chairs?   The barista made my hot chocolate with milk instead of water and put a nice serving of whipped cream on top. The young man who served us was extremely friendly, genuine, patient, and hard-working... and quite cute to boot.   The cafe is in the NoDa neighborhood (North of Davidson), a two-block assemblage of eateries, alternative shops, a concert venue, etc. It seems to be the only area in Charlotte that doesn't suck. The only problem is that many of the places around are closed on Monday-Wednesday nights.

CrZFByYCZClMHHOsgal8uQ.text: Smelly Cat has become my de facto office this semester since I can't seem to find anybody to give me a real one. I'm in Smelly Cat right now...I love it here.  The staff is friendly, and the decor is fun. I love the doors. I wish there were a few more plugs for the laptops, and a few more food offerings would be nice...but I can handle these little defects. The coffee is good, and you can sit here for hours without anyone bothering you.

2gIznrfpNwd04XifRfkKIA.text: As much as I enjoy the always popular Starbucks and the lesser known Caribou Coffee, Smelly Cat is a wonderful change of pace.  The decor is awesome, the service is fantastic and, most importantly, the coffee is outstanding!!

5glZtnI6UX5uBPIupW5jSA.text: Smelly Cat smells quite delicious-wifts of freshly roasted coffee.  Another flattering review of Smelly Cat seems redundant, but here's my observations about this place  -High "perk" factor of baristas-I can't even pull off that level of perkiness with liberal doses of caffeine  -Variety of bevies- Chai lattes, a different flavor of iced tea daily on special, several roast of coffee to choose from.  They keep iced coffee (don't know if its cold press) but it does the trick.    -Dilworth coffee used in coffee beverage-It's "dil-worthy" of praise, wha wha whaaa!  -Smallish-Though I wouldn't likely loiter here for hours, I would certainly visit Smelly Cat on a lunch break or before a big day in NoDa (or night, if you know what I mean).  The overall experience is great.  I like light or medium roast coffee and I find it to be a tad bitter here.  It's really good, but it's not as smooth as I've had in other coffeehouses.  Overall, Smelly Cat makes NoDa what it is.

T1uoEdcNKfX71-P9maUvRg.text: Great little place in Noda. Super cozy and warm. I'm particularly a fan of this place in the fall and winter.

xd5R4T0L1DDNoLTMoMRB5A.text: Smelly Cat is such a cool, cute coffee shop. The "smack your mama" cake is delish and the tea selection, while a little high priced, is wide. I came here with my mom and a friend and even though there were 3 of us, we had to sit in the little booths made of recycled wooden doors, hung with local art. Magic!

J42fP1SpqF1ZNhivhE5JTA.text: More of a meeting place for NoDa than a coffee shop (at least to me). The coffee is standard - but you can tell there is a lot of love for what coffee shops represent. And lets face it, you don't really just want a cup of coffee when you're hanging out at Smelly Cat...you want to feel cool that you're drinking coffee in public with your friends and neighbors.

1phTerQBvvfBwXnbWlGRVA.text: Located in the NoDa (North of Davidson) district of Charlotte, NoDa began its rebirth in the 80's after the areas last mill closed in 1975. Artists with a vision of creating a new fringe arts district are off to a good start, opening several shops and restaurants bordering 36th Street and North Davidson. Among those businesses is Smelly Cat, a locally owned coffee shop that aside from coffee, serves sandwiches and other snack items including a uber yummy peanut butter pie.   Small booths are constructed of used doors and the overall decor is rustic with a sprinkling of cat items throughout, there is outdoor seating as well as a small parking lot to the side of the building.  While NoDa is a bit out of the way, it is one of the more interesting neighborhoods in Charlotte and Smelly Cat is a fun addition to this district.  The first and third Friday of each month brings out the free "Gallery Crawl", where the galleries stay open late in the evening.

nVRNZu1lt63KvFZNAnEgyg.text: I typically enter into a coffee shop with the hope of getting a delicious cup of coffee or espresso. I arrived at the Smelly Cat with this expectation and was severely disappointed. The coffee was very bland and my friend who ordered espresso was also disappointed in her order. It is definitely a cool place to hang out, despite our lack of proper caffeine buzz we played Scrabble for at least two hours. There are board games to be played and it would be an excellent place to study with some goodies on-hand to nosh on. I would not recommend Smelly Cat for a delicious or satisfying cup a joe.

Tj_wkaJs-X4qFd8t0sXkmw.text: Perfect fit for Noda neighborhood of Charlotte... don't take the "Cat" for granted; our little 'hood wouldn't be the same without her!  Great coffee, great baristas all right here within walking distance of all our other great Noda spots!

88uxYGHn1CxFl12vIGn0OQ.text: I don't drink coffee, but they have the best hot chocolate in Charlotte.  I'll slap you if you think Starbucks hot chocolate is even average.    Also, they do have a private lot. I'm not sure why 2 people said you can only park on the street...

6BLi6V1yHE088bGuq9aMjg.text: Coffee not at a chain is hard to find in charlotte. I love buying local and on my days off. I am more than willing to drive the extra ten minutes to get it. The coffee is the best I've found in town and the service is equally great.

zucliogOqKmQnPOH3yDobQ.text: The perfect NoDa neighborhood coffee shop.  Free wifi, delicious coffee, ice cream, and delicious (even gluten free) snacks.

q72qM6l-HHBpvnRRm_6LUA.text: ha just like nicole...i sang smelly cat smelly cat the entire ride to the coffee house.    great selection of drinks, pastries, and super cute atmosphere.  great for hanging out with friends, grabbing a quick drink, or even a business meeting if you want to get away from the chain of starbucks (which i'm not really a fan of)  highly recommend and will definitely return!

trJMoD0shKCmFOJMcF2AjA.text: Went there twice while in town for the Belk Bowl.  My wife and I are hooked and secretly hoping the team goes to the same bowl again so we can have some awesome coffee and hot chocolate.  Definitely a MUST VISIT if you're in town.

r36OGzZLR4N1YddiqHAioA.text: Any time I get coffee anywhere else (*cough*starbucks*cough*), I regret not going to Smelly Cat. They make great espresso drinks, amazing hot chocolate and brew great coffee. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is really chill. A great place to sit and do some work or hang out with friends.

ViKIE6F0_cDdyzLWEN9ZNQ.text: Beautiful Sunday morning, artsy little cafe, sun shining, hot sweet chai, people enjoying the day inside and out. The door partitions between booths are just as cool as other reviewers said. I look forward to trying other beverages and hanging out...

zrouQotpSl9_-XV6wyr_ow.text: Such a cute coffee shop by our Airbnb in Charlotte! Stopped in here on our way out of town and wishing I would have found it sooner. The staff was really friendly and the coffee was tasty. I also had a breakfast sandwich that didn't dissapoint!   Been back here a couple times now and make it s point to grab an iced coffee and sit outside. Relaxing coffee shop for sure!

4fC0189s_-89IzMGQ7A1FA.text: Facts: - Phoebe Buffay does NOT work here!  - Charming and cozy coffee house. - Offers pour over, cold brews, specialty espresso beverages, or caramel apple ciders. - Selection of breakfast bites, pastries, and fresh bagels. - Indoor and outdoor seatings.  Great spot. Four and Half Yelps.

3Z8GCcKE4kY_YxRDa8ADgA.text: Smelly Cat is everything - and then some!   First off.. the name! Gotta love Phoebe!   Second.. the neighborhood. Love it.  Third.. the decor. So dark and hipstery. Not usually my vibe but it is done so well, here!  Fourth.. COLD BREW. All the cold brews! Like four of em!  Fifth.. beer.  Sixth.. homemade syrups! That toasted coconut syrup is perfection.. coconutty, toasty, and not cloyingly sweet!   I'm a fan!

ZoXDvjHBoFN9T4N8CfrbuA.text: Still love this place!  And the super baristas who make amazing coffee!  It's got such a cozy feel and they have a lot of tables outside for the nice weather!

GL7NSZsJXGfEwtQa9A12KA.text: My Experience: Lucky I guess reading other reviews, but I drive right up to a parking space beside the building. However, I can see there could be a problem in parking. Especially, if you are not familiar with this area like me.   This coffee shop is small with inside seating as well as outside seating. It's completely comfortable once you find a seat inside. Outside Seating looks like it would be the place to sit at if the weather is nice and not hot like is right now on this late June day.  They do have WiFi but the password must be given to you at time of checkout. The password is something weird. The cashier wrote it down on a piece of napkin but I couldn't read her hand writing. So I took my IPhone 7 to her and she typed it in for me. She also did my MacBook Air. So, that's great customer service.  How Discovered:  I found this place because I use the Yelp App. I hit directions to take me here but it was wanting me to use a path that included a road closed. I believe it was 36th Street. So, I redirected my Yelp GPS and I finally got here on a Sunday morning just before noon.   Menu item ordered:  I studied the Yelp listing, reviews and photos taken and decided on the toasted coconut frappe with whip cream. It's a cold sweet drink with caffeine that is perfect for this time of year in early Summer.  It was delicious and was so good that it was gone within a few minutes.  Final Thoughts: I really like this coffee shop. Yes, I would come back if in area. A lot of college age students were at this coffee shop while I was here.  Now, there are several colleges and Universities close by and it looks like when the students visit this business when they are not in class. Also, when looking outside down the street the visit other local establishments close by too.

jyYEy0q8pHZtQWpQ5m8eiQ.text: Very cool place. The staff is super friendly and the atmospher is trendy. Much more affordable then Star BUCKS and less pretentious.

5g1repjDOhTufRdDz15uxw.text: Extremely cool, hip spot in an eclectic neighborhood. Grab your coffee and delicious pastry and walk the streets to people watch it view some cool murals. The coffee is delicious with house made syrups and of course, the baristas are knowledgeable and accommodating.

1tHni4Ouz28kR3Qzh1ridA.text: Always a fan favorite. My go to coffee shoo go get espresso. The atmosphere is nice and it's a place to Relax. They make their own syrups which is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

B-LpDV1mY8mRgtZxrJMp-w.text: Made a quick stop into Smelly Cat Coffee on Monday afternoon. I went with a Toasted Coconut Frappe.  Quality Smelly Cat Coffee was a necessary last stop before leaving Charlotte. Desperate for a boost of energy, we decided coffee was the answer. Feeling adventurous, I decided to go with a more elaborate Toasted Coconut Frappe. And while I did enjoy the milkshake-like coffee drink, it quickly became too much sweetness for me. Good in a small dose, but definitely something to share. I think I would have opted for a more traditional selection if given another chance.   Quantity My Frappe was very large and maybe a little too much for one person. I ended up handing it off to my girlfriend about two-thirds through.  Value My drink was about $5, which seemed like a decent deal for a specializeed drink.  Ambiance Smelly Cat Coffee is located in the NoDa area of Charlotte. In an area full of live music venues, old school theaters, and rows of little shops and restaurants, the coffee house fits right in. Outside they have plenty of tables and chairs set up to enjoy a beautiful day. Unfortunately the weather was not behaving and with little shelter outside was not an option. So, we ended up inside, which at first felt cramped, but after a short rush, felt more cozy. In terms of decor the shop is busy, with things everywhere, mostly related to coffee. They had a bar near the front, several tables in the center space, and then a few uniquely crafted enclosed tables on each wall. The larger back area was reserved for making and serving coffee. The building felt like it had history in its bones, and while that adds charm, it was frustrating dealing with wall sockets that could not keep a charge and tables that were a little too rickety. In the background alternative rock music crooned over the speakers, which I also believed could use an upgrade.  Crowd The place was busy on Monday afternoon, granted it was a holiday and I'm sure folks needed coffee to get going after a night out. The crowd seemed mixed between folks who had settled in with books, newspapers, and computers, and groups just grabbing coffee to go. It was a younger crowd and I got a very hipster vibe.  Service The girls behind the counter were friendly and quick with drink preparation. Even during a rush, they seemed to have no issue in pushing out drinks fast.  Parking The coffee shop is located in a small town center. And despite some construction going on, plenty of street spots were available.  Extra Smelly Cat Coffee got the job done while searching for a pick me up in the NoDa area of Charlotte. And had the weather had been better, I believe I would have very much enjoyed sitting outside and sipping on my cool beverage. A place that probably needs more visits for a more complete analysis, but one with plenty of charm and solid coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Toasted Coconut Frappe

_Q7LUplNcyaCNLrnIyS5ug.text: I have been to a lot of coffee shops, in a lot of different places. Smelly Cat is one of a kind. They are there for their customers and excited about offering the newest and greatest coffees. And, while at the same time, they provide a great deal of the usual coffee options. We did not try their food, but their coffee was excellent.

1fyQEmsSxl7eFtQ-HJzvAQ.text: I was looking for a coffee and this was the highest reviewed, so I came here. I do not live in Charlotte so I had no clue what to expect. I'm not sure what they did to the blended mocha I got, but it was honestly the best coffee I've ever had.   After being rejuvenated with a cool, caffeinated drink, I tracked down a Lime Scooter and drove all over North Davidson. Thankfully, I didn't get run over. I parked the scooter in front of Smelly Cat, but I'm sure it has been moved since my visit!

fOM7nl_KPxL61tZFC8WADg.text: This seems to be "The Coffee shop" in Charlotte based on reviews so I had to give it a try.   I will say that space is limited inside, but there is also outdoor seating. I personally do not like sitting outside if the weather isn't just right. But that's just me.  I ordered a dirty chai and an egg and cheese biscuit. I found a comfy space and tucked myself into a corner. Both the latte and biscuit were delish.  I would come back here to write. I liked the vibe and the people were very nice.

JP0G5eYiS_GroOSxJpZ-9A.text: For a non-coffee drinker, going to a coffee shop seems like a dangerous choice, but Smelly Cat still delivered.  Located in Noda, once again, maintaining a charm unseen in other cities, Smelly Cat was a hipster paradise (and I say that in all the best ways). With a modern flair, and comfy seats, I sat at the window to people watch.   My breakfast on this particular morning was a vegan bar that was perfect size, with a hot cocoa on an otherwise chilly morning in December. There was nothing wrong with the flavors I enjoyed on this particular day, and if you are a coffee drinker I imagine, based on the hot chocolate, that you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan breakfast bar and hot cocoa, a worthy breakfast.
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice, hipster coffee joint for a non coffee love!

zrrvVnCzJ5fUje4ayf21yA.text: I've been coming here once a year or so, for about 15 years. It's evolved quite a bit over time, since NoDa has changed drastically over that period as well.   It's very cozy and has that artsy feel. Comfy seating, and it all feels right at home in this neighborhood. Dirty chai is delicious. It's a good place to work in the morning, before it gets crowded.   The employees used to be amusingly rude when I used to come here ten years ago, but the ones currently here are very nice. Much appreciate the change.

jG489c4QBgjGhcJ9CPWwUg.text: Smelly Cat is a great coffee shop in a great location! It is one of my favorite spots to work from when I need a change of scenery. You can't always get a spot, but eventually someone will leave if you stick around. The coffee is top notch. I usually get an iced latte. They have the BEST blueberry muffins in the world. It is such a treat.

rQ3coEYPUj7PnIV185oT0A.text: Puurrfect place for coffee! Smelly cat is super cute and very "hipster"; it has a decent amount of drink options, but minimal seating. During the spring or summer, the outside seating can be utilized, but during winter or a cold fall day, indoor seating may be scarce during busier hours. I very much enjoyed the fact that it's a super short walk from the light rail stop. Therefore it's convenient for students from uncc as well as anyone coming from uptown Charlotte. It's a very nice location as well, there are multiple eateries right around the corner, just a short walk, desert places, and places to grab drinks with friends! The pricing is fitting for the quality, not bad at all! There's bar seating as well, so feel free to bring your laptop and get some work done, it's an excellent place for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Iced dirty chai with a view of the bar seating.

h5VQDyFmSJYTYzBTbxj5Ew.text: Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, what are they feeding you?!  Ha!!  Aside from the Friends reference, I can offer a great review.  I thoroughly enjoy coming here for a tasty cup of brew.  I really think the vibe has changed since they took out their on-site roaster; bring it back.  Don't get me wrong, it's still a cool place.   One of my favorite things about this place is that they make their own syrup flavorings.  I normally get vanilla syrup added to my coffee and it is phenomenal.  They have plenty of food options, but let me warn you.... I got a cheese biscuit and it was like eating rubber.  It was so bad I had to throw it out.  They should rethink their biscuit preparation.     Service is always fun and friendly. Parking is horrible, and there are not enough seat for dining in.   They really have outgrown this location.   Go check them out, but be prepared to park and walk!!

XQXPcKBCV8nluIODLS2Crg.text: Fun little coffee house in the middle of Noda uptown.   Quality of coffee isn't bad. I would definitely prefer here over the S*bux line. Seating is lacking inside, and it is a small place.  Staff is fun and kind of funky, which adds to the overall charm. After all, this is Noda!  We like to come here whenever we are on this side of town. Good little place.

aM7eZi8IG8lbO-337I0xKQ.text: As a FRIENDS fanatic how could I not like a place called "Smelly Cat"?  (does literally everyone write that in their opening line *rolling eyes at self*)...hee hee hee :)  A cute little place. Repeat TINY. Would love this place as a solo-venture or even with the hubby but with kids in tow...nada in NODA. The black drip coffee was decent. I opted for the black dark organic roast. Thumbs up. Took a sip of husband's medium roast and it was crazy bitter. However he says he enjoyed it so there you go. ;) As far as gluten free they had a delightful peanut butter bar; stole a few bites from the kids and it was sugary delightfulness. Very rich. Anywho. Super cute place. Enjoyed seeing NODA and cannot wait to get back to the neighborhood to try out some of the food and culture fare.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. How can you see this and not giggle...seriously have you no soul? ;)

L3L0ObKQuuSDrcH851Y0PA.text: I love this place. It's a prime example of how to run a small business. Everyone is always friendly and helpful. It's always clean and the coffee and food are fresh and delicious. I just recently moved to that area and it's been a great perk to living here. It feels like the soul of NoDa and it's a great place to start your day.

EKA5p97bQvmS5dJ0pnMUIw.text: Nice coffee, quaint atmosphere, and reasonably priced. However, I'm afraid most of the staff may drop dead at any moment because they're all dangerously skinny. If those guys aren't vegan then they need to see a doctor. If they are vegan, then they need to stop. If vegetarians laugh at your diet then you probably shouldn't do it.   Oh, try their milkshake, it'll change your life.

uVLbyM9Ue6HhM0sUGzXVMQ.text: Oh Smelly Cat, can I come live in your space? I can bake the gluten free treats you offer along with your other pastries, stock your cooler with Odwalla and blynk organic products that you provide, clean for you plus treat you really well. I would make sledge hammers within a minute, give spectacular service and make sure your paintings done by local artists would sell. I would make sure all the little pods you have are spotless and that the Wi Fi was working so free wireless for everyone! I can give you the love you really need Smelly Cat, the love you deserve. You have been so good to me in the past with the aromas of various brewed coffees, reasonable prices and kitschy design, I feel like it's the least I could do for you.   Let's turn this dream into a reality. Love,   Tiffany

AR8AbJomqcyDaXuq1HYaSw.text: Met some friends here for coffee on a Wednesday morning and loved it. Went back again today for another cold brewed, iced coffee.   Great decor (very funky) and I love to sails they use to give shade on the front patio. I would have locked a little something to eat but the baked goods weren't that appealing. I did buy a couple bags of coffee for home though.   If you're in NoDa and appreciate excellent coffee, stop by the Smelly Cat!

SRgMzmrAKpc5p_lWSzyTzw.text: I can't get enough of their amazing iced chai Latte and dirty chai Latte! hopefully one of these days, I'll get to try something else off of their amazingly extensive menu. They're probably the only place (or may be one of very few coffee shops in town) that serves cortados! and if you're not in the mood for caffeine, you can have beer, wine or ice cream instead. I wish they had better food options; it would be nice to have a fresh croissant with the coffee :)  the staff is wonderful and friendly. I've found that the ambiance in there is a reflection of the staff's mood.. late on a Saturday morning, it can get loud with chatter and music, and then there are times when it's quiet enough to get some reading done. They're a bit pricey to be my every morning coffee stop, but not at all a bad option for my weekend coffee fix..  you can pay by cash, card or Square (pretty hip huh ;) )

7XIjeLFCSY_P0r76gf4v9Q.text: I used to love Smelly Cat because their coffee was excellent and their baristas were really awesome and knew all sorts of things about coffee that I couldn't even begin to understand yet still found fascinating (possibly due to excessive caffeine levels making everything super exciting).    Their coffee is still good and their baristas are still wonderful, but lately, they have been enforcing more and more policies about their bathroom and parking situations that just make them seem less welcoming.  Having to go back out into the rain to put my signed time-stamped receipt on my dashboard so that I'm allowed to keep my car there for two hours is not okay.  I understand the bathroom code because according to one of their baristas, some not-okay activities were happening in there, and I even understand having to ask for the wi-fi, but it's borderline rude to make customers feel like they have to validate their presence in your establishment.  Sure, parking is tight but it's NoDa and parking is an issue everywhere-that's the nature of the beast.    Anyways, they have good coffee, but I'm a little disappointed in their new customer policies.  It's less annoying to just go to Amalie's and put up with the ridiculous weekend crowds.

4qbMznCfEYHqlN8FtEcP7A.text: Awesome coffee shop. Went there to start our date night. We got a Sweet New Orleans cold brew and my bride got the spiced brown sugar latte. We also got a slice of the zucchini bread and a morning glory muffin. Super tasty. We will be back.

RG7icw1ARs663ZrXfsOnzg.text: This place is super cool with great customer service. We love to visit NODA and stop here. Frozen drinks today -spot on. You can also buy whole bean coffee they will grind it for you.

aS7xrunUfIj6qCMUG41gNQ.text: Chunky monkey! Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey! Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!Chunky monkey!  Holy sheet! Order this tasty thang called a chunky monkey! Wish I visited Charlotte more often....blows atl coffee away  Pst......did I mention  Chunky monkey!

3bPXQjOaIl_ahRtgEhLWew.text: This NoDa staple is everything you'd want a coffee house to be.  It is quaint, eclectic, cozy, and it has some of the best coffee you can get anywhere in Charlotte.  As you walk in you'll notice a cabinet with board games so you can grab a cup and hang out for as long as you please while taking a trip down memory lane with a nostalgic game of Battleship.  You'll also notice the tables and booths around the place that make for perfect spots to chill or converse with friends.    The coffee is as fresh as it gets.  You can't miss the roaster where all the magics happens right there near the counter.  You can get all kinds of fancy hot or iced drinks or keep it simple with a cup of the Tanzanian brew (my personal favorite).   And the folks there are friendly and unpretentious.  They're helpful if you have questions or wish to venture outside the box to try something new.  Remember to tip!  If you visit NoDa and want the True experience that sums up the soul of the neighborhood, you must stop in here!

JBSbtq72bjQUznKN-HbOgg.text: I love their drinks and their staff.  Unique artwork on the walls, sometimes available for purchase.  Seating is somewhat cramped.  They also have a drum circle outside every Friday from 8:00PM to 2:00AM.

J7rXUO8G40_sE-A-jYeSkw.text: Went this morning to meet up with some friends for coffee.  The place is relatively small which makes it difficult for groups but great for studying or getting some work done. That is if you can keep your attention off of the interesting characters passing through.   If I want to escape my boring, finance job, jcrew lifestyle and hang out with shirtless Longboarders doing yoga and praying to rocks, this is definately my go to place.

BXZ1170IhSYIDXNBvXedpg.text: Best coffee in Charlotte!  This little gem is in the heart of NoDa.  The coffee is amazing, the owners keep it upbeat and fun.   There is a great selection of breakfast sandwiches that are fresh made in the back, and delicious fresh muffins.   There is free wifi, you just have to request the password of the week.   It's a great place to do some work during the week, meet friends, or just relax on a Sunday.

67K1Ntjji19WD4nY2ItlRA.text: The customer service is impressive. The coffee is mediocre, but they keep me going back. They're always helpful and friendly, and the vibe of the place is great.

0ItbTDHtR1qW9ZAFluvz-g.text: I didn't have coffee but my wife got a cup, cool little place and quick service. The staff really knows there coffee right down to the flavor notes the different beans are giving off. She always gets coffee from there when we are in NODA during the day. I really like how they roast their own beans. Next time we are in NODA, Ill have to get a coffee as well.

dl18BJ2N_Bb9riCGw6IHcg.text: Great coffee, great service, underrated loyalty program. Very convenient.   Only negative, once saw the owner (manager?) yell at the staff in front of all the customers. Lots of turnover, but the staff is very good.

d4tZWLy1_W-rhl-TnNye8A.text: Smelly Cat Coffee House is everything I love about local coffee place.  They have a relaxing vibe, a cozy, eclectic space, friendly staff, and some darn good coffee drinks.  I have ventured to this place a couple of times now.  I had a coffee drink the first time and a chai the second time.  Their coffee good; smooth, not bitter at all.  The chai was great as well.  Where some coffee places make their drinks too hot, both times my drinks were at the perfect temperature for immediate consumption.  I also had one of their big cranberry orange muffins, which was moist and not tart at all.    The space is cozy, with a few tables around.  It has a rustic, artistic feel to it.  The staff has been friendly, always striking up conversation.  It feels very inviting here.  I only wish I lived a little closer.

57bpnpkAC2Ilpm_ISs8yLw.text: I always like coming here. Friendly staff, chill environment, good for reading/studying.

l5Q1PQpUR3EwowmAxb6ajg.text: Stumbled upon Smelly Cat Coffee with some friends while we were in Charlotte for the weekend and looking for a caffeine fix on a Sunday afternoon. The name, of course, instantly brings to mind Phoebe from Friends. I ordered a frappe because the weather was nice and I wasn't disappointed. Actually, the only disappointment was that they were out of whipped cream (!). Whoopsies.

G44Y_BfQ8TO3ItVOPhgwNw.text: Hip little joint. Had an excellent New Orleans style cold brew--exactly what I didn't know I wanted. Staff was sweet and helpful. Perfect place to while away an hour or two.

xMPtBr7gjUY6ShO1Xa65tA.text: What a cool place to have a good cup of coffee! Loved it so much I bought a shirt!! It's small but a must try if you like cool coffee spots.

AQlys62J3-RjB3_bNPgUZw.text: Cute cafe with great selection of drinks. Could use more indoor seating but it has a great vibe for talking or studying. I wouldn't come here with more than one person at a time, but you can def enjoy a couple hours here easily.

rgS9JSkJ4f8ZL27qntaVtA.text: A representative from this restaurant responded to my review both publicly and via message telling me that their employee offered me items that they did not and that I received "on point" service and that my review was unwarranted. Their employee lied to them. We were not offered any such items. I wish we had been as they do sound delicious and would have likely saved our experience. We looked at the menu offerings, ordered several items to which she only repeatedly responded "so sorry we are out of that." Smelly Cat's combative and "customer is wrong" response to my review only furthers my negative opinion of this restaurant and it's staff. I am simply a visitor from out of town looking for a good breakfast experience who was sorely disappointed. I have no reason to lie, but the employee does. The restaurant management would be better served addressing their employee performance and dishonesty rather than acting like they were there when they were not and treating disappointed customers with hostility.

WWvb2vvBm3apHk5K87HU-A.text: I'm not a coffee drinker but I ended up here on a food tour. It's such a cute place. The decor is nice and there's actually plenty of small tables for lingering despite the small space. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable about the products and the beans are all roasted in house. While others in my food tour tried the Colombian coffee, I tried mango iced tea. They also had really delicious no bake treats! Stop in!

2qwlCMqp0QPzAPHhIK2rig.text: Great coffee, fast service, polite staff. They alway great you genuinely and not with a fake forced smile.  Great outdoor seating but inside is a little cozy.

gLeINkMdIWEx6AZ4kF2jdQ.text: I didn't watch Friends so the reference was lost on me, but damn was that an amazing dirty chai! The entire shop was cool and I recommend it. I really like NoDa.

YWT9VXIOBg79VSxt7vXUgA.text: I went to this coffee shop simply bc its name caught my eyes. It's located in the Noda area (which parking can be such a chaos), but it has its own private parking lot  that's a huge plus. Also free wifi too!!!!  The shop has a very cozy fell to it, and has about 10 small tables inside and outside. It also has its own roasting machine, I guess that's a big plus for HUGE coffee fan. Personally I like my coffee sweet and strong like cuban coffee. However, I made the mistake of ordering a Hazelnut cold brew. I mean don't get me wrong I still like it, but I prefer some sugar to it.  I came here to do a little research, since we haven't install internet at our place yet. After sitting there 3 hours, I decided to order a Chai iced latte and lemon poppy muffin. The latte is pretty good, but didn't stand out to me as a MUST have in my drink list.  I will definitely go back for the extremely friendly staff, and to try the cuban coffee in a colder weather.

x3cQ915DG7roEeJbByuH1A.text: Good coffee and they have BEER! This place is unique; it has a very artsy vibe.  Generally much better coffee than Starbucks, Caribou and Dilworth coffee.

VHRWMtHsHIv0S0IWm78Isg.text: The best Chai Tea Latte I've ever had! My friend and I came here maybe a month or two ago. It was my second time, her first time, so we asked for a good recommendation. The girl who helped us was very sweet and welcomed us, and mentioned that their Chai Tea Latte was pretty tasty. Chai Tea Latte's are one of my favourite drinks and so of course I wanted to give this one a try. My friend and I both ordered one, and when one of the staff members brought it to us at our table (which was also really nice!), we were both really impressed! We will definitely come back here.  The atmosphere was very cozy and welcoming. Board games are available for you to play with whoever you happen to be with!. We brought our own deck of cards so we played that for a while and a group behind us was playing a Harry Potter board game! Felt like I was at a peaceful family get together. Haha!  All in all a really great experience - I've recommended this to basically all of my friends.  The location is wonderful as well! Easy to just step out and walk around NoDa area and explore a bit.

tJt9i8W4sIU6nhSimDXd6w.text: Wonderful local coffee shop!  The fact that amazing cold brew coffee is just a couple of blocks away from my house is like a dream come True.  Friendly staff, they roast their own beans, my wife loves the lattes, and there are some nice seating options (though they are few).  Highly recommend Smelly Cat if you want a great cup of coffee, latte, or cold brew!

v6p37m98uPzi4RRc-vQpKA.text: Was visiting Charlotte over the long weekend and was really happy to find Smelly Cat open on a Sunday night and full of people. As someone who can drink coffee and go directly to sleep, I love a good late-night coffee shop. My cortado was perfect, the music was awesome and had me Shazam-ing more than one song, the baristas were super friendly and fast. Wish I could bring this place back to Brooklyn with me!

sEJUOM1DY47B2c2shoEzbw.text: Funky little spot in which we found by luck. I had the caramel frap and I must say it hit the spot. The girl at the counter said they made their syrups and caramel, I indeed could taste the "home made" in it. The caramel was sweet and even a tad-bit salty which made it even better.  Finding a parking space was no problem, which is always a bonus. It being a Saturday night they were having a group of people doing spoke word session, which made us have a good laugh and added more personality to this coffee shop.  Got 3 coffees, and 4 pastries for less than $30 and had a great time.  Will be back soon for more caramel fraps!

y42XdGb-NRfEQkpA64Eilg.text: Very good tea, nice atmosphere and very friendly staff. Even working on a Holiday, everyone was enthusiastic and nice to customers. Loved the place.

QPoaaV19aKbSooV0vCVsaw.text: Cozy place for drink coffee, work or play some games with friends. I love their different coffee beans.

oFXLVMGa0qD-vz_sOubuSA.text: Good location in NoDa, the only coffee shop in CLT to offer on-site roasting- big thumbs up!  The coffee is very good, a little inconsistent- sometimes grounds in the bottom of the espresso, sometimes slightly bitter- but no big deal. The staff are quite friendly but aren't as open as other coffee shops, don't tell you about their coffee- but again, no big deal!    The vibe is very welcoming and enjoyable, a good stop for some good coffee.

ON3Y47LctwsbfuDk7bdN0g.text: When I walked into the Smelly Cat, I thought I had finally found a nice coffeehouse in Charlotte (visiting from Seattle for a week).  I liked the funky decor, the brick walls are covered with old doors and other interesting nick knacks, and they use more old doors to separate some of the tables into booths, with electrical outlets.  Outside it was sunny and there are nice little tables to sit at.  The first sign of trouble though, was when I asked for a "cappuccino for here", and was told they only had to go cups, but "they did plan to get real cups sometime this year", if I wanted paper cups, I would have gone to Starbucks.  The second sign was when I picked up the cappuccino and felt it's weight, there was clearly very little foam, and obviously was more of a latte, again I could have just gone to Starbucks and got one of their "wet" cappuccino's.  The final straw though was when I tasted it, it had hints of that taste you get in coffee from a run down truck stop.  I am not sure if they don't clean their machine or what, but it actually made me crave the corporate coffee.  I recommend that anyone visiting Charlotte to try Fabo in Selwyn Corner instead, it at least tastes a little better than the corporate stuff.

Dqq8flc2JPqK-Hj5BJm2BQ.text: This is definitely the 'homey-est' vibe of any coffee shop in Charlotte.  (Well, that and Mug's.  But, Smelly Cat is like studio apartment in NoDa homey.  Mug's is kind of like your Grandma's living room homey)  SC is warm, eclectic, and the music they play is dope.  Coffee is solid, too.  I dig it and go here often.

fYLPOf-I_4Q5o60Vb-ldOw.text: The atmosphere is very relaxed, and the baristas are very friendly! The shop is small and a little cramped but they have seating outside as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. White Mocha with whip cream ($3.55 small) pretty good, has a unique taste to it.

zVXwCQd1g9XI8PkHmjhuQA.text: Cute, eclectic place with good coffee! Has some food items available as well but didn't see any good vegan options that others reviews mentioned - may depend on the day you go though!   Cool place to get some work done or meet up with a friend or two - has a nice little outdoor area as well.

FG0YX4QhAqsLcAGI7L6EZw.text: Since I visited three years ago I've now moved to CLT. This coffee shop is a staple every weekend and I live 25 minutes away. The neighborhood and the people that work here are amazing. It's a great place to socialize for you and your pup. The no carb breakfast and the breve lattes are phenomenal.

eLESqVHYPhUwYAfQ_MsUKg.text: Now serves liquor!  Had a margarita which is on special today.  Friendly staff and comfortable atmosphere

d8QhY0VzlXrijZ4QgYR7gg.text: Awesome coffee and most of the syrups are made in house. I love the cozy, eclectic feel of the cafe and the employees are all very friendly and helpful. I come to Smelly Cat whenever I'm in NoDa!

OW5VH3cuJEQ8ybG_ehZclQ.text: Stopped here for the obvious Friends reference and the super cute logo was a plus! Staff was not engaging or helpful... not rude but certainly did not improve the experience. Drinks were average in cost and unremarkable beyond that. Could be a super fun place and we just went on an "off" day?

cp0_56sfc_7GVDrmV2uRwQ.text: By far the best latte I've ever had in my life! It was a black and white latte and it wasn't too sweet which is super important! Small space but perfect area! NoDa is the best pet of Charlotte if you ask me! The staff was very friendly and the prices were affordable.

BPl-sh1Qz7APS3VkXhUnRw.text: Great atmosphere!  Who wouldn't like an Irish coffee; Jameson heavy cream!!!!  We were here visiting family, this was our first morning stop!  The staff is great as well.   I wish they had someone on the bar side instead of having to order on the coffee side then go back to the bar side. I'm sure they are trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

FMgN81yk64efX2_JCFTWGA.text: Do you remember Phoebe's song- smelly cat? :) Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, What are they feeding you? Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, It's not your fault  Well this coffee house in Charlotte has no connection to it. :) Smelly Cat Coffeehouse Roaster is an award-winning local coffeehouse and Coffee Roaster. It's located in the NoDa neighborhood in Charlotte and is very charming and quirky. The coffee house has seating in the front, side of building and inside. The inside is decorated in this rustic farmhouse vibe and is a very cozy space. They have a few nooks inside for seating two.   The barista that served my friend and I was very pleasant and patient with us. It was our first visit so it took us a moment to decide on our drink of choice  for the hot and humid Sunday afternoon.   I ended up ordering an ice latte with toasted coconut syrup and almond milk. I took a sip and thought, man oh man, this is a good cup of coffee. The coffee had a smooth and bright flavor, no bitter taste. This would definitely be my go to coffee shop if I lived here. Great coffee, funky atmosphere and good service - love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enjoying my coffee
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Art on building
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside one of the nooks

xWYD7LGqLUKYglxC08D54Q.text: Found their selection to be kind of limited and their coffee bitter but they offer some other items and they sell related souvenirs. The ambiance is pretty nice as well. Service was good.

c3mCH9ThtrjicDVTlZtivA.text: Smelly Cat is a cute little cafe right in the heart of NoDa. The cafe is right across the street from some bad a** new condos and apartments! You couldn't ask for a better location!   Environment: I love the way that they use repurposed materials to decorate their space.  When repurposed materials are used for decorating, you really have to have an eye for what goes together well  and Smelly Cat did it well! You walk in and you see booths made out of reclaimed wood and old doors, exposed brick, and duct work. They have free Wi-Fi and outlets to plug in your laptop and phone. The place is cozy, functional, and visually interesting. There is also outdoor seating. They are coveted so good luck. We drank our coffee at the bar facing the window and scored outdoor seating as soon as some people left!   Service: Very Friendly! The barista explained the different options including the many food options, various brews, and their homemade syrups.   Coffee: Great! I followed the advice of some of my fellow Yelpers and ordered the dirty chai over ice. It was creamy, sweet, and delicious!   There is a parking lot that isn't that far from the cafe. It was reasonable and a short walk.   I enjoyed my visit to Smelly Cat!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

iSFL1_hRI7CoP-gcPfQwuQ.text: Stopped in purely because of the name and being a big FRIENDS fan after an overnight trip to the area. We were not disappointed! I got a BEC biscuit, it was absolutely delicious! Big, flaky biscuit. Large scrambled egg patty. Just enough bacon and cheese! My boyfriend got a burrito and we split one of the huge blueberry muffins. Everything was great! But my iced dirty chai with oat milk and a shot vanilla was probably one of the best I've ever had! And to top it off, instead of numbers for your order, you get a picture of a FRIEND! We'll def stop by again when in the area!

3n_CjWz5ghA0lL_SzAo5HA.text: Cute, quaint little cafe! More exciting experience if you're a fan of Friends haha. Got the organic Black Cat coffee-was great! They do close early here n here so be on the lookout for the whacky timings.  Def would visit again!

y_Jzw2-KdKurUSmvZd8V9g.text: Cute interior. Okay coffee. Nice staff members. Nothing that hit home, but it was worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dirty chai latte
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Snack options!

6CLy5jtGiIIm25IzHwu4Aw.text: My boyfriend and I were in Charlotte for the Spartan this past weekend. We stopped here for coffee and sat inside since it was raining. Love the atmosphere here. The baristas were all very nice. They let me try their different cold brews before deciding on one.  The music was on point. 90s throw backs. Really can't ask for much more from a coffee shop. The coffee itself wasn't the best Ive ever had, but the location and atmosphere made up for it.   Usually there is a Farmers Market behind here that runs on Saturdays. We were going to try and check it out but it was raining so no one showed up. Super bummed!

IRUsYvk3gGPS-8cForBpqQ.text: Solid spot for grabbing a coffee and doing some work. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Also liked the touch of saving with by bringing your reusable cup, then being able to donate that right on the spot to multiple charities. Only downside here is the food options are limited and not made to order. They have some pre-made food options, along with your standard grouping of pastries.

n36x5zh5RUBFH4P_3xQpgw.text: How did I miss this place for so long? My daughter and I spent a few hours walking around Noda and a visit to this coffee shop was on our list. It is a really cool place. I love the inside and outside seating (a lot of it). The decor is cool and they serve great coffee's, beer and wine. Definitely worth stopping in if you are close to the area.

m2FIOYYfDSKHdiCPV_kmKg.text: Cool little place with some good tea options. I am more of a tea drinker, so it is nice to find a coffee place with different choices of tea.

-9a71nei7F6r4wnH3X7M4w.text: It was hot, had a couple of annoying flies flying around, packed with limited searing, and their regular dark roast drip coffee was nothing special.

H01WWNd_liNNRFH0v_bIVg.text: The cutest coffee shop! We looked up some "must try" places on a weekend trip to Charlotte and we decided to try Smelly Cat Coffee Roasters while we were exploring Noda. The exterior is absolutely adorable! So quaint. I ordered a cappuccino and my friend ordered an iced chai. Both were great! They have lots of bakery items, and a breakfast menu that looks awesome. Highly recommend for atmosphere and great coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

5RUYVTVAGJd1GFDz5coqWQ.text: love Smelly cat! Went on a quick weekend trip to Charlotte and we stopped her for about an hour for coffee. The atmosphere of the place is very chill, lots of people hanging out. The inside is a bit dark but really cool decorations.  Staff was friendly. Ordered a cold brew which was delicious. Plenty of other choices and I saw they had food, including biscuits.  We sat outside and enjoyed the sun. It's dog friendly in most areas and has shade if it's too hot. smelly cat for the win

jTmEaL-OV9KRWGWlvACVOg.text: Smelly Cat,  Smell-y cat...it's not your fault that you will like this place.  Breakfast items are very good and the coffee hits the spot.    The one-off menu items that I have tried are also very good.  The pumpkin/banana bread is a nice complement to the coffee.  Worth the drive and dealing with the wanna-be hipsters on the way there.

gQwlbO3vR57Utm84JIGf5g.text: What a great, local coffee shop!   Located in the NoDa district, it boasts subtle charm, friendly baristas, and worthwhile coffee. In a sea of Counter Culture coffee shops (which are not unappreciated, ftr), I applaud their independence earned by roasting their own beans in-house (on a 25lb Probat, no less).   Their music selection is current and trendy, appealing to most 20-somethings. They offer both manual pourovers, ready-brewed air pot coffee, along with full espresso and tea service. The free (passworded) wifi is also a plus.   If I had one qualm, it's that they serve flavored coffee offerings. Since they prepare all their offerings in-house, the lingering aroma is a little overwhelming. But coffee aficionados: don't let this dissuade you from stopping! They do a fantastic job with their roasts.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Probat roaster and their barista bar.

NIHGrxRI7u-HINO1_bL9Lg.text: Probably the best latte in Charlotte. The espresso isn't overpowering or bitter, and they have lots of different syrups that you can try in your drink. I usually go for the toasted coconut. It isn't too sweet or fake tasting. Their pastries are great as well. They always have different seasonal things to try out. The baristas are always nice and the WiFi is fast. The seating isn't the greatest, but I've never had the issue of not being able to find a seat, even during the rush.

pyKmyh3R1ZOpQ5XJ5NTZ-Q.text: Definitely in love with Smelly Cat, I work down the street so I come up here quite often. They are friendly and fast. Great customer service. Their coffee is great, it's fresh and smooth, perfect roast. Their lattes are delicious and creamy even with non-dairy. I love that their iced beverages are made with crushed ice. I also get their teas, smoothies and snacks and have always been satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

8WWuWb2R8-UsDB9ZAhi61A.text: First time here. It was decent coffee but there's better in Charlotte. The breakfast biscuit burrito was good. A little overpriced imo but overall pretty good. Staff was extremely friendly so that's a huge plus. It's in a great location as well!

z8dba18rK-apeelEt5ZhOw.text: Can't talk shit about smelly cat. It's perfect place to get coffee and imagine that you aren't in Charlotte anymore.

-gZ67t3bCQxDUzirXZ0LCg.text: Been here a bunch of times! The coffee is always on point, everything from the dirty chai, to mocha, both iced and hot. Their breakfast is good too. We've had the different biscuit combos and the burritos (my favorite is the bacon, egg, and cheese). We had the breakfast casserole before it was permanently on the menu, if it's the same one that's on the menu now, it was AMAZING!  My favorite drink: mocha frappe with skim and a squirt of peppermint

Cr_7inDmRF0zLZn9uEKV3g.text: Every time I come in here, the girls are so sweet and cheery in a genuinely welcoming way. I feel like a friend to them, and man is that nice. Their drinks are really lovely. My favourite beans are light roasts, which they don't really favor, but even still their coffee and lattes are pretty good. Coffee never tastes burnt (which is rare in this industry). They take pride in roasting their own beans and do a solid job of it. The atmosphere is homey and rustic. That is what I love. Well crafted coffee and a homey setting that screams "oh come, ye masses of chaotic lives, come and sit and just be."

o_FQO79ixGdELJ4JgkamQA.text: Super cute coffee house. The reviews don't lie-the dirty chai is perfect. Coffee bean burlap bags cover the ceiling under exposed beams, while the walls are lined with "booths" made with recycled wooden doors. The drink menu is small, but covers the essentials. The atmosphere was quiet (Friday late morning) with people studying intently and Bob Marley playing intermittently between bouts of silence. I was disappointed with the food selection. The items are pre-made, wrapped in foil and kept in a glass case display warmer, reminding me of late night drunken 7-11 visits in my early 20s. There were maybe 3 different types of pastries in a similar (empty) case. I had the southwest burrito which was lukewarm, but tasted good and did the job, but I won't order it again. I will, however come back for that dirty chai!

iYakd0JsCCRIAz6PAzjAxg.text: If I'm ever having a bad day, I always make a point to come over to Smelly Cat for an iced soy dirty chai latte. The baristas are always happy and make a point to ensure your experience from the time you enter the shop to the time you leave with your coffee is positive. The chai is not a syrup like some of the independent coffee shops in Charlotte and is made to order. They also have yummy biscuit sandwiches and breakfast burritos if you can get there early enough. Lots of seating inside and out and a great location if you just want to take your coffee to go and walk around NoDa. Even though they sell something as simple as coffee, their passion and amount of care they put in to their drinks really does make a difference. Smelly Cat is one of the examples I give when people ask what I love about living in Charlotte.

ycUB3K2_VRo_87gHgMdR5A.text: I love smelly cat coffee! This is one of my favorite coffee shops, for sure in Charlotte, but may be of all times. I love the nostalgic feel inside and the seating outside. The variety of drinks makes this hole in the wall a special place to visit.  Sometimes parking can be a problem on the weekends, but if you don't mind a stroll, you can easily find parking up and down the street.  If you come hungry, don't worry! Their breakfast burritos are cheap and fantastic!

oxQYKlDeQbLewWRCqte05Q.text: Very cool !  Awesome little coffee shop in Charlotte North Carolina. Great coffee, cool relaxed atmosphere, you can even sit and get some work done if you want. The coffee is stellar ( try the Ethiopian ). Theme he has lots of great lite selections to grab and go if you need to. A must stop for coffee lovers when in Charlotte NC.

pzB2AFN52D5RPA1NirbcQw.text: Quite an adorable coffee establishment and the only one in the neighborhood (it seemed) on a Saturday at 11am. Service is friendly and the line moves pretty quickly.   The chai latte I ordered was decent. A little heavy on the milk and not so much chai flavor, but still an ok choice. I would probably order a latte the next time around though. My friend went with the peach smoothie, which she said was "okay" too.   I bought a mixed berry scone to go with the latte, which actually turned out to be rather disappointing. The texture of the scone was mushy rather than crumbly and the mixed berry flavor was faint. They didn't have a good selection of pastries (which was slightly disappointing). My almost $7 breakfast was an "A-ok" in my book, so 3 stars it is!

T13rXBAnfxK_-G__MYalnQ.text: Great service from attentive baristas who have not learned to burn coffee like Starbucks, and also fail to give a convincing apathetic attitude to suggest they are only doing this until their art sells to a generous patron.  In fact, Smelly Cat has easy off street parking in a fashionable neighborhood, and is an enjoyable place with good bakery items.  They may learn to be disappointing someday, but for now they actually measure up.  Get there soon, or don't.  Then I will get more coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. You can also park in back for $2 cash or around the block for $5 cash.

DoC6Cplw-_cRed9K1ogXUA.text: No odorific felines here. Just solid coffee and a quaint, comfy coffee shop. Loved looking at the art that lined the beautiful, exposed brick walls.  They roast there own beans on a beautiful, red drum roaster right next to the counter. So you can get super freshly roasted beans to take home.   Their prices are really good and their offerings diverse. I'm really looking forward to trying more of their menu... I might need a Cuban coffee soon!  Support local business. Check this place out.

v_ywAsI2D_RB4Mzyt0LUaw.text: I am SO shocked to know I haven't reviewed this place yet. I probably go here most out of any other coffee shop! And always for their chai. Their chai is so good, it beats Amelie's chai's butt. As does their hot chocolate, yum! They used to carry really yummy Italian sodas and ice creams but stopped it.  The highlight of this place is their outdoor seating on a beautiful day, but even the inside is cute and cozy. My favorite thing to do on a weekend morning is to get a cup of chai at Smelly and walk down N. Davidson looking at the quaint little shops.  However nothing beats hanging out here on Friday and Saturday nights until 12am during warmer months.

gCzkU2hRasour9FQE4xcdA.text: First off, I hate coffee and always have. Let's just get that on the table.  When my friends wanted to stop here for some coffee, I figured I'd just sit with a bottle of water and wait for them to finish. But then I noticed that hot cocoa was on the menu. As it was December and in the 40s, it seemed like a nice fit.  HOLY CRAP. There were chunks of real chocolate in there, AND I was asked if I wanted peppermint in it. Seriously? All this time I thought I was the only weirdo putting peppermint in hot cocoa. No one's ever OFFERED it before! It's like the mother ship was calling me home.  This heavenly concoction was thick and full of flavor. I know no one's ever made a claim to fame by having the best hot chocolate, but this place totally could.  The environment is quaint as well. It's quite eclectic, with several nooks and tables for you to settle into with a good book. 90s music tends to play frequently, and the staff is very nice.  A year later the same group of us found ourselves in Charlotte again, and I refused to leave without stopping at Smelly Cat for the best hot cocoa in the universe.

HPC2n0_Te5mjFPKoZZG8vw.text: This is my new spot for Sunday afternoon coffee! A large cappuccino, a spot at the coffee bar and relaxing atmosphere is where it's at. On a hot summer day, I saw just about everyone ordering one of the many flavors of frapps. Can't wait to see what this place has in store for upcoming fall season...lets hope it'll put the Starbucks pumpkin spice latte to shame!

pQkI1SmkWyHX006xc_3x_A.text: Cute coffee shop. Not much seating inside but more seating outside if the weather is nice enough. Yummy iced chai latte.

ReWpX4PzCk0x1YToEGVeWw.text: Definitely the best coffee house we've been to so far in NC!  The owner is personable, the coffee fresh roasted and delicious, and the ambience very relaxing. We will be back - probably frequently!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

lFQ9hdSfD5tE0LvaAGeXAQ.text: We went on a weekend trip to Charlotte, NC from Nashville, TN. We came here for a breakfast one morning!   Let me just say the woman Sam with the blonde hair was so kind and patient while we ordered. Sam was just plain amazing! She helped us with recommendations for breakfast, which we decided on the breakfast sandwiches (it was incredible and so fresh).   She even helped with our coffee order too and talked us into the lighter coffee telling us that this was in fact stronger (which was so cool that we learned something new).   Sam was amazing, smiled, made us feel comfortable, welcomed, asked where we were from, and didn't rush us through our order. We'll be back! Sam's an incredible person to have at your company!

sHLOq4fopauA3qBQ61Pcdw.text: Really cool spot in Noda that for whatever reason I have never visited or even heard of. We were looking for breakfast and Yelp lead us here. It was pretty busy on Saturday for breakfast. There is not much room so it can get crowded pretty quickly.  We both ordered sausage egg and cheese biscuits, one on a cheddar chive biscuit and the other on a regular biscuit. We also had a cold brew the Llorona and an iced brown sugar spiced latte. The biscuits were soft and flaky. We had no complaints with the food and the drinks were really good.  Smelly cat is definitely worth a visit if you are in Noda.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar and pick up window
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage egg and cheese on a cheddar chive biscuit

HACKZWoMvTg6d-otuK62VQ.text: have visited many coffee shops around charlotte, looking for a third space with just the right vibe.  most are cosmopolitan, yet unpretentious and while they are great at the craft and very welcoming, i never felt so at home as i did on my first visit to smelly cat.    imagine your grandma opened a coffeehouse to serve all your favorite coffee drinks and killer food as well.  there are so many places to sit and parking was surprisingly accommodating.  bathroom was as clean as grandma's!  did i mention they had four cold brews ready for me to choose from?  i had one each of the ethiopian and the llorona; completely different ends of the spectrum and whisked my tastebuds away on a matchless journey of cold brew wizardry.  i ate a mediterranean quiche and half of a sausage egg and cheese biscuit.  i'm a burly boy so i eat what the toddler doesn't finish.  the quiche was outside of my normal breakfast range and tasted great!  the disruption from my normal plate of eggs and city ham was transformative.  the aforementioned biscuit was around 3" tall and 4" wide with a melted slice of cheddar on top of a breakfast sausage patty.  cheesy not greasy!  my toddler had a chocolate milk blended with ice chips and topped with whipped cream.  i tried it when he was playing with some other kids and understand why he didn't put it down for the first 15 minutes!

ulUY3w25PGfnEhnKFLrSVA.text: Just an overall dynamite location. The name itself captures your attention. They have many beverages, pre-made breakfast food or they can make it while you wait. The owner who we get to talk with often takes pride in her staff displaying good customer service. They are always trying something new from interior remodeling, no more plastic straws, and a walk up window.   Definitely stop by and get smelly!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. No carb breakfast: Scrambled eggs, cherry tomatoes, arugula. Minus avacodo and added bacon.
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

5Fc5Cm6MS1N8zXNNbdffBQ.text: I've been here a few times before over the years, each a different occasion: studying, catching up with a friend, a quick coffee, reading. This is probably one of my favorite coffee shops in Charlotte because of the setting and amazing coffee. I read my book here today for nearly 3 hours and was lost in my own world in my small sitting table with a comfy chair, plug if I needed it, and small walls to keep me from seeing too much commotion around. Also never felt pushed out by any of the staff even after I finished my coffee (normally I would leave or get a refill but I had 20 pages left of a riveting book).   With my nut allergy, they were super mindful of making sure I had a different milk frother than the almond one which was a nice touch.   Definitely a huge fan of this place and will be coming a lot more often to read. I also love the friends reference.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vanilla latte

mpE3upwgyf9nW8Ilq3Gq5A.text: Cute local coffee shop over in NoDa! It's the perfect place for a beautiful spring or summer day. Patio and inside seating for whatever vibe you prefer!   We walked over and ordered from the walk up window and my iced oat milk latte was delivered straight to my chair!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oat milk latte

1uckui6ctFlCaW_srilDuw.text: I think I see myself coming here every day....I love this place! It's my first time in Charlotte and I happened to have stumbled across this place on yelp and I couldn't be happier. First off, the whole FRIENDS theme won me over. On top of that, they're strawless and have lots of interesting brews. I got a Vietnamese cold brew and enjoyed it while sitting out on the patio. Places like this definitely make me feel more comfortable as an out-of-towner.

The coffee was good ... but not amazing like Counter Culture. The iced chai tea latte was amazing though.   Definitely give this place a try!

Lu4XR4FBrKwDg5NBTrFV2A.text: Ok.  Yes, the only reason we came here was because of the name.  It's a funky LITTLE place that has coffees, liquors and food.  I got pre made and my friend ordered a bagel.  It's be nice if cream cheese were out on the bagel since we waited long enough for it but hey...no biggie. If you bring your own cup, they'll give you ten cents off and donate it to your fave charity ..that's cool...no plastic straws...that's cool, too.  It's a place I would come back to I'd I come back to clt.
