wl2JeKng5axlljtPm8xPUg.text: Who doesn't know Smelly Cat Song popularized by Phoebe Buffay in hit sitcom FRIENDS! It's a great place to get gourmet coffee  and breakfast. I love the atmosphere and setting is like the FRIENDS show. The place is crowded. Friendly staff they're great! You should try this place.

KL-2VlURBnH7R1kOE93mcQ.text: When I moved to Charlotte, I was on the hunt to find my goto coffee shop. I stumbled upon this quirky, quaint cafe and fell in love. I come here often with my dog, because why not!? They're super pet friendly and offer outdoor seating with water bowls for your furry friends. Not craving coffee? Sit at the bar and have a cocktail! Love the atmosphere, sweet staff, and location!   Great place to meet at before exploring Noda!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dirty chia with my Watty boy!

riXpYiXS_mNt39Z9LnUxlQ.text: This is hard to say, but it really goes to show how much customer service really matters, especially when it comes to attitude. My iced chai with oat milk was phenomenal, and I love that they applied the mixture to blended ice HOWEVER:  My husband and I ordered both a cold brew and an iced chai, and when ordering his drink, my husband asked the barista about her favorite options. He often does this to encourage baristas and add some variety to his order, however we were met with such an icy response that it threw us both off and I even jumbled my order when it was my turn.   I can empathize with someone that is having a rough day, and I completely understand that one glimpse into a baristas day does NOT show their entire ethical scope. But we also noticed some frustration among the staff that could have been dealt with more professionally. Such a shame.

HdCIKpMisuKCPouBv6ImlQ.text: Nice atmosphere and tasty coffee.  Enjoy the iced lattes and excited to try to hot beverages when it's cooler outside. Love that they have almond milk up front at no additional charge!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vanilla latte with almond milk.

mZ-5hVPU-RZ3QzWe0NJ9Xw.text: I purposely went to this place because of the name. I love cats...and the tv show Friends. I was overwhelmed by the menu but eventually chose a dirty chai iced latte, it was so good! I regret getting whole milk, but that's because of the hot weather. The cashier who took my order was so incredibly friendly I would go back just for her! The cold brew too was delicious and slightly sweet, it didn't need anything extra added to it. I've heard this place had a good reputation and I was happy to experience the adorable decor and coffee myself. I even bought a shirt cause...duh...smelly cat.

UrmTzz5vEgoO9ZjGYB1aGQ.text: This place is so good!! The toasted coconut frappe was amazing!! Nice little spot for a quick coffee or to sit and get some work done or read a book.

IcI8FR5G0URKBhRkkUJbeA.text: I love coffee shops but I can't say that I visit them all the time. I'm not one of those people that drink coffee every day but I do appreciate a chill place to catch a vibe! This place was it for me this past week. My friend and I each ordered food. She ordered a breakfast sandwich while I Opted for the no carb bowl. We each got frappes as well. I have to say the dirty chai frappe is probably the best one I've ever had. It was a perfect mix of not overly frozen but not super watery. The no carb bowl was great as well. Scrambled eggs, arugula, tomatoes and avocado!  It was a perfect healthy breakfast. The weather is getting super warm so that means a lot more sitting outside. My friend and I grabbed a table and actually was able to sit for a couple hours. I definitely will be back because I just loved how it's such a chill place with great food! Did I mention it's in one of my favorite parts of town! Yes visit this place ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. No Carb Bowl

vOKiYwTrhBSFPhmeYKZXfA.text: My life motto, Life happens between COFFEE and WINE, but not just any coffee. In what seems like a sea of new coffee shops in the area, not all stand out for many reasons to me, and oddly enough, for their coffee! They tend to be modern and fit every bill for those that work remotely -   a quiet place to work, caffeinate, but miss the mark on the coffee! I personally like a full bodied coffee, I do not like watery, mild tasting, drowning in milk/cream/oat/almond milk sort of buzz. I like that some of these shops have the option but again, completely miss the mark on the coffee. I am emphasizing on this because, Smelly Cat did NOT disappoint!   Location: NoDa is my neighborhood and I LOVE it, but I will be the first to admit that the parking situation is annoying. Smelly Cat has a limited amount of parking spaces and be careful, they will get your car towed if you aren't actually a patron. The fact that they have the parking, is a plus. Its a little house with seating outside amount all around it. The inside is small, but these ladies do not mess around. The inside has this modern, rustic chic thing going on and I like it! The small nooks at the front entrance for two are ADORABLE. The front bar area is new and they have breakfast cocktails. It took me a minute to realize what the update was, one because I was in need of coffee but also clearly, they served drinks.   Some Notables I must come back to try (pic of menu included in this review):  -Mexican Hot Chocolate: Tequila Blanco, truffle chocolate powder, steamed milk, cayenne, marsh mellows - yes please  -Dirty Chai Cocktail: Elijah Craig Bourbon, West India spice chai, espresso, milk, cinnamon - yes again  As noted, the espresso drink I had was simple with an extra shot (I had things to do when I left). I ordered a bacon egg and cheese biscuit sandwich and it was very good.   The service was fast and friendly. An all women team, not sure if this is their thing but I like it anyway - Girl Power!   Very well done ladies....I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. I just love the name
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fun notable bar drinks
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee beans to go

gqHr-dU-6F8kDsP3hnaoUw.text: This place is OKAY. The coffee is good except they messed up my order. However, they were nice enough to fix it. The area is cramp to the point that I got elbowed by someone. The parking is also the same as it is inside, cramped. I had some of their zucchini bread. It was okay. To be honest, I may come back or I may not. It wasn't that special to me and the only reason I went is because of the reference from Friends.

FIsIXCRyKrwvIkEUYmWszw.text: It's quaint. It's cool.  There's friendly employees. There's relatively easy parking. Inside and outside seating which is a plus. The food is as good as the coffee! When they ask if you want a biscuit, say yes! My favorite is the vanilla latte, the large has three shots of espresso! They have options for milk including almond and oat.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

dq_dOaLlS2YQ2fVEoRyGnw.text: Good spot for this area, I was visiting family (from NYC) so I thought it would be nice to try a local spot. Coffee was really good, strong flavor but not too sweet. 1 star off for Breakfast sandwich I had made, it wasn't my favorite, they didn't ask how I wanted my eggs and they forgot cheese as well.  Overall great location- would love to see the night life at this spot. Also seems like a good place to get work done.

zwz_cF7O7J1dYDkJasA-ZA.text: My conscience is forcing me to review this place. Selfishly, I'd like to keep this little Noda treasure all to myself.  Cannot say enough about Smelly Cat Coffee shop. Superior, friendly staff...excellent coffee and delish pastries. And probably the coolest place to hang out in Charlotte. Super friendly patrons...lots and lots of dog lovers to chat with. And really great outdoor spaces in front and on each side. My one regret: that they're not closer to my place in South Charlotte.

3LQ38ow6ImIhU5RoiGn9yA.text: It was good experience .  It was something new and favorable , I am not a big fan of coffee or tea but it's a good spot if you enjoy that . The best part is the interior and atmosphere . I liked it .

nkWHV6kxlwI-n3-q_lH63A.text: Short and sweet (okay not really but I'm a thorough person I guess). Point by point, at least:  + Girl at register was unpleasant and aloof, but in a particularly unusual and rude way, not just in the stereotypical "aloof coffeeshop employee" way. I felt like I was actively burdening her with my presence even as I stood there quietly and patiently waiting for her to be ready to take my order. One star off. If I lived nearby, that interaction alone would put me off returning regularly. Not a good sign.   + Fella who handed me my drink? Pleasant and cheerful. Plus one.   + Iced dirty chai? Awesome! I love the crushed ice and weird spice thing (I can't totally describe it but it's like what would happen if someone crumbled a ginger/molasses-flavored Oreo wafer in the bottom of the cup) going on in it. Kind of wish there was a little more ice to cool it a bit longer, but that's not a True complaint because I'm a slow drinker. Plus two stars.   + As I was sitting outside minding my own business in this glorious weather (I live in Durham, decided to visit Charlotte on a whim) while texting my brother in Colorado, a member of a ministry student group(?) who was meeting outside decided to come up to me and try to "share something" with me. As a devout atheist, I actively discouraged him and he went away pretty quickly, but it was very unpleasant. After that interchange I left the warm sunny bench I was sitting on to retreat to my car. Minus half a star because I know this isn't the business's issue, but soliciting/proselytizing at customers should be actively discouraged. Not sure if this is a regular weekend meeting place for the group of fellows or if it was simply happenstance on this particular day.  + Parking is confusing as fuck. I'm not familiar with Charlotte "this side of sign" parking and gave up on their terrifying(!) parking lot immediately and parked down the street. The weather was nice enough that I was fine with walking farther, but in crummier weather, I can't see doing it. Half a star off.   Three stars. The drink was great, the ambiance less so. I will admit 100% that I went here based on name alone (and the picture of a drink with crushed iced, I guess).

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Iced dirty chai. You can kind of see the spice stuff on the bottom that I mentioned in my review. Also, CRUSHED ICE(!)
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Benches outside.

Z9pLKSeHPaiYY5pRFoAiNA.text: My first Charlotte coffee shop visited. Love the vibe--inside and out. Always clean and friendly! Barista was excited to share cold brew samples with me. Tasty coffee. Nice seating. Good music choices. Adequate internet. I have enjoyed studying here. Great location. Parking can be hard, but with a little walk, it's not a problem.

Oikm78vUyYkJBFij-TXEtA.text: So I've probably passed this place a thousand times since moving to Charlotte and finally stopped to see what the good ole smelly cat hype was about. It's a little vibrant coffee shop located in the Noda area. I'm a huge iced coffee fan but I thought ahhhh what the heck I'll step out of the box today. I tried a iced vanilla latte with almond milk and it was okay. You have to have an acquired taste to drink them but they were really good but much different taste from a iced coffee to clarify. The young lady behind the counter was super nice and helpful. Even let me sample a few things! Loved there outdoor seating and the fact that it has shade so I can still sit outside and enjoy a nice book even in June 90 degree weather. I'd definitely say try it out they offer more than just lattes!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Iced vanilla latte with a book on the side

YohtJiYchj-HImLT-JKhfw.text: I only went twice, but the breakfast sandwich was great and filling and the latte was perfect. My biggest problem with Starbucks has always been that they burn their espresso beans and it just doesn't take good; Smelly Cat has such a perfect latte, I never add anything to it.  Also, cool atmosphere and a great place to go for my first time in Charlotte. Thanks so much.

C0MpNcj0_CAMbtQdKYB5tg.text: Fantasic, cute, coffee place! Amazing frappes and smoothies. Came here with my nephew, brother, sister in law. We each got frappes while my nephew got a smoothie! So tasty and delish! I got the toaste coconut frappe and it literally so was creamy wet and silky smooth! I cant stop thinking about it!  The parking is a complete nightmare mess in the area and there are signs everywhere warning of towing. Smelly cat even suggests putting you recipet on your dash of your car to protect it from towing.  I would be back here in a heart beat! Beat frappe of my life. However, took off a star for the parking. It wasa royal pain and a total frightmare !!!  Be ware !

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. My nephew loved his smoothie and my mom loved her frappe ! ;)

7RX-8wjrOB9Yq7-lOYphyg.text: Man, I miss living in NoDa. Count this place as one of the 59384759 reasons why.  I use to live a few blocks away on Yadkin, so Smelly Cat became one of my second homes. You may have seen me riding around there as a passenger in Gman's golf cart. We are former roomies. Hi Greg.  Coffee, hot chocolate, tea... hot, cold. Whatevs. It's all fantastic. I was excited to have a meeting with Nathan B. over there today and reunite with my coffee shop. We were successfully productive despite a whole lot of eye candy visiting Smelly Cat this morning. Meow. See what I did there.  In a hurry? Grab a cup to go. Looking for a place to post up and get some work done? Make yourself at home and fire up the laptop. Make sure to snag a baked good, too.   The workers at Smelly Cat are super friendly. They pretty much know everyone (if not actually everyone) in the 'hood. Plenty of parking in the SC lot and also on the street. Easily accessible.   If you're in or nearby NoDa, be sure to stop by and get your caffeine fix here.

0GFKPbjkvXnZR2S_cyUBGg.text: I am an out of town-er; we came to eat at the NOLA themed restaurant across the street and the waitress recommended this place for more variety of coffee. I had a hot chocolate with 2 shots of espresso. It was better than ANY mocha I've ever had! I love that they use ghiradelli chocolate for their drinks! If I lived in charlotte this would be a favorite for sure.

S5jfWQQzs1KGxFBqsRpYag.text: This place definitely delivers when you are looking for a neat little coffee shop in a new town.  I was around the Charlotte area for an interview and I love exploring coffee shops in new places.    I loved the local art hung up on the walls and the earthy feel of the place.  The people who work there were super cool too - the guys behind the counter gave me a lot of great recommendations.  Not only do they sell awesome coffee drinks there but they also serve alcohol - unfortunately I could not imbibe.  I got their pumpkin spice latte and it was amazing.  I also brought some work with me and was able to be productive in my quiet corner of the shop.  Definitely check this place out if you need somewhere to chill downtown!

usOcoCaEDz-H7zx_YBI_5g.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the good cappuccino, nice people and cool ambient of the cafe and the whole neighborhood on an early Sunday morning. Also kids-friendly: great cocoa. The name of the cafe is a mystery for me but if they secretly serve Kopi luwak coffee I wouldn't mind :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

FLZa9CW7tm7tYMFULk23lg.text: I love the atmosphere. It's warm and cozy ad the perfect place for a nice warm drink and relaxation. Love the chai latte. Prices are good, friendly service. I will be back.

n6tGscLh-m-f1rr9PfeZGQ.text: The. SWEETEST. STAFF. EVER.  These guys have all the right ingredients for creating a great coffee, business, and experience.  My hats off and wallet open to this business.

wuLzWtRxCjgc4X1MKOcPIw.text: After trying all of the big hitters, I would rank Smelly Cat as the best coffee in town. The location oozes edgy, which partly comes with being right in the heart of NoDa. The baristas all ad to the vibe with the friendly quirky natures, and possess the ability to make a sublime latte. They usually have Ethiopian blends which is my personal favourite thing about Smelly Cat, but they also have a lot of other unique brews from all around the world which makes each visit seem like a new adventure.

MbD-o38-mUxm6nZ_2NRadw.text: One of my favorite coffee shops. Favorite drinks are dirty chai, caramel latte, and white mocha. Two problems: close very early Monday's and Tuesday's, and not nearly enough seating inside.

5dilxXTUwSmu1FJ9uMB4wg.text: Funky little joint that quickly went on my itinerary based on the name alone! Sweet New Orleans was the iced coffee I got in the store as well as as a bag of NoDA espresso and their dark blend. Haven't broken into those bad boys yet but the place was nice and clean. There weren't any room in the parking lot so I had to park a little in the sidewalks.

WpX4qmmNF5pF7xdyJjTFHA.text: Very neat and unique coffee house with cute seating inside and out. They have a roaster inside, and have yummy baked goods.   They also sell merchandise with their logo!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Almond latte!

JZCKnoGYG7vq9SrYtshNmA.text: Tried the sweet New Orleans cold brew, southwest burrito and choice cheddar scone. All were delicious!

oFuqoGHolOZ149Wf-UKd6w.text: Came in for open mic night. Wasn't a great night. But its a cute shop, and the coffee was real good. The parking is a pain, but its like that no matter where you go around here.

fJWBrSf0kDzC7XODb180Mg.text: I absolutely love Smelly Cat!  I generally get an iced white mocha.  My favorite thing to get there is the Cheddar and Chive Scone.  It is delicious!

rL_PNDS9m6pWlUChHfGOfQ.text: Good coffee, good shakes, good pastries, good people, great atmosphere. I heart Smelly Cat!

Q-tqYIHVxoabKgTNPM02Cw.text: No complaints. Great coffee. Awesome employees. Overall fantastic experience. Wish I had a Smelly Cat Coffee House back home in New York.

_fwtZbe7IXrmyTDxwkeRSQ.text: Friendly service and a great cup of Joe!

shMmBY2aJPe11yFZHs2kqA.text: One of the coolest coffee places I've been to.  Love the repurposed doors for booths.  Great WiFi.  People talking and and playing games. The place makes you feel at ease and want to chat it up with the locals.  PLUS they use Square on their iPad for card processing... nerds will understand that one.  Oh, and the soy latte I had was great.  Oh, Oh, and the service was great everyone seemed to be happy to be there and work together.  *sigh* love

ZGp-_MsHY1gF7tL9eXMZjA.text: Hands down the best coffee shop in Charlotte, and one of my favorites anywhere. Staff is incredibly nice and welcoming, atmosphere is fabulous, and it's in a really cool part of town. There's a nice variety of brews offered each day, and I've never had a bad cup. They roast their own coffee which is always a plus, not to mention a decent selection of pastries, beer, and wine. I'm not in Charlotte very often anymore, but whenever I'm there I try to stop by.

oMGaOXZjAD7bw5hSIYICDA.text: First time going to this coffee house. I've heard so much about this place so I thought I give it a try. It was amazing! I had the Dirty Chai with soy. Very good and very nice people. I will be going back for sure.

--DiZOzXn1uAPpdom4Hqhw.text: Absolutely perfect. Free wifi great coffee and great atmosphere.

5zUbzGreyTO74gfAp9AO-A.text: We went in for the name and free wi-fi.  We stayed a while because of the awesome vibe.  Smelly Cat is in the fun NoDa neighborhood.  There were 80's tunes playing when we arrived, local art on the walls, and excellent re-purposing of old shabby chic doors to form - I don't know what to call them - maybe table cubicles?  The doors divide space between tables along the walls.  What a great way to create semi-privacy.  I've never seen that done before, so major snaps for creativity.  Loved the concrete coffee bar and exposed industrial ceiling.  Smelly Cat is ultra hip.  Oh, with good coffee, by the way.

f3fnxFi96V9HryJrdkAlOQ.text: Slow but friendly service. Excellent chai latte. Relaxed and comfortable atmosphere.

nsPgrp0-VUbb993_FZ9NuA.text: I visited here once and really like the coffee here. However, I have gone back two other times and left without getting coffee because I could not find a parking space. That is a huge headache that will prevent me from going back. Coffee is good but not that good for me to circle the establishment for ten minutes looking for parking.

g1lo2RJ1-5UanKgXcK9u5A.text: I wish Columbia had a place like this!   I've been to Smelly Cat (what a name!) twice and both times have loved it. I think last night it really took my breath away.   The reason I'm giving this place five is more for atmosphere than quality of food/drink. To be honest, I've only had a coffee, a tea, and a red velvet cupcake at the coffeehouse so I can't say I've sampled that much. From what I've ordered though, I've been very happy with what I got. As for the service, both times I've been to Smelly Cat, the baristas have been very sweet and professional.   But to talk about the atmosphere, well, WOW. Especially last night (Friday). I don't know if it's like this all the time, but the place was oozing community and felt so good to be a part of it. When we got there it was around 9pm and we wanted to get coffee and dessert and play a game of scrabble. There were a couple of tables outside and a few wicker benches to choose from. One table was occupied with a group of friends and their very loving and playful dog. Another table had a musician playing the xylophone. At one of the wicker benches, there was a small group playing the guitar. We snagged an empty four top and proceeded w/our scrabble game. Several pedestrians with dogs and children walked by. As the night progressed, a drum circle formed around the xylophone player and they created magical music. Many people who walked by stopped to dance and interact with the musicians. Inside the cafe as more people came in, there were others like us who cracked open board games and drank their coffee and chatted away.  I hate to sound new age, but the energy was astounding, and it was really cool to get to share some of it.  Also NoDa is a beautiful area, so the combination of the neighborhood feel, warm almost summer breeze, the music, and the smell of good coffee, was just priceless.

N0MFano2o0C3Uz1Er2gqoQ.text: I'm actually kind of heartbroken that I've lived in Charlotte for so long and never made it out here until today.  This place is awesome, it's the exact kind of coffee-haven that Charlotte needs more of, and it's situated in the cool streets of Noda.  The staff is helpful and engaging, the atmosphere is really conducive to quality conversations but also provides great space for someone who needs to plop down and grind out some work.  More importantly though - my drink was fantastic, and their in house bagels are phenomenal!  This place could definitely be my new go-to coffee place.

JaaFTD50Z79vPEg9KmX4Gw.text: Great coffee drinks, awesome friendly staff, chill comfortable atmosphere and good music. Delicious baked goods with gluten-free options. Wide selection of board games. Outdoor patio and wi-fi, you can't ask for much more in a coffee shop. Private lot parking adjacent.

nfrwVfD8F_AG4wGszvC57g.text: Great coffee. Lovely ambiance. Great place to catch up with friends or take a few moments out of your day to unwind. Also, the artwork changes out, so you get to scope out lots of artists.

vfcVEVySH_R0lilnOVHZiA.text: Lacking. This was not the worst cup I've ever had, but the place left a lot to be desired.  I opted for their Ethiopian off a V60 , and when I prodded the girl at the counter for a little more info about it, i.e. where was it grown, she looked at me crooked and said "Ethiopia". Inspiring.  Another woman behind the counter who sort of looked like she could have been the owner said that was a valid question, but didn't know the answer and didn't bother to find out. The technique on the pour itself was poor. Splashing water over grounds does not make good coffee... Especially when half the water is poured straight down the filter. These folks need proper training. The cup itself was marginal. Under extracted likely due to bad technique, and the characteristics of the cup were such that, to me, suggested the roast had gone too long in the drum, slightly carmalized and somewhat scorched.  Lacking the bright acidity that draws me to beans from this origin.  Considering the near non existent coffee culture I guess there's not a ton of motivation for a shop to shine when they can squeak by on a convenient location, but really, if you're going to do something, do it well.

RX9QfELV9lBb9phcU2_7wQ.text: I am not a coffee person, so if you're looking for a review about that, move on. I'm just here to say as a water drinker, this space is ok. The parking lot is small, so street parking is almost mandatory. The space inside is a bit cramped, but eclectic and fun. The menu does have some non coffee stuff, but the pricing? Ouch! I love the idea of you, but I'm never going to be a Smell Cat person..... ps: dogs are better! :D

06n5xSlhVWyMJ2B8u-Aqfw.text: This is my go-to spot to work on projects and concentrate outside the house. Good coffee, friendly staff, free wi-fi, and comfortable seating. Parking can be hard to come by if there's an event in the neighborhood - most often on Fri/Sat nights or Sunday mornings. The chocolate chip frappe is my favorite drink.

WhInAsHZ4tBynbBBYtwuWQ.text: Not enough stars! This is what you envision when your looking for a cool place to sit and enjoy a coffee. Although I love coffee, my first visit here I had a green tea because I also love green tea and I was already amping out on caffine....  I'm looking forward to my next visit  and have a cup of joe, as I'm confident that it will be as good as the tea. This area of Charlotte known as NoDa reminds me of South Street in Philly. Very cool/ seemingly nice people everywhere just doing their thing. This place is right in the epicenter. Came in feeling pretty shitty and left in a much better state of mind. Good music in the air, mellow lighting, nice muffins and other pastries and Strong wifi. I opened up my devices but found myself just enjoying the ambiance of this place and shut everything down and just chilled with my eyes closed for a while. I may become a regular. If your in NoDa check this place out. Btw...  unlike starbucks, you can order a SMALL- MEDIUM OR LARGE!

_eVAO-gBqT3uVjPFdDXrSA.text: Great coffee, fun atmosphere, and the staff were super friendly. We stopped here on our way to an event around the corner, and it was great. Their specialty is the dirty chai (chai tea w/1, 2, or 3 shots of espresso). We really liked it.

IJ-KsgD1hk16PaOynhpGOA.text: The coffee is great as usual, but now they've added fresh cooked breakfast items! I've tried almost everything and my favorite is their fresh made everything bagels with bacon and egg. And the items are setup to be taken on-the-go.

GhCU99aWG6_DXdJmOU11Ug.text: My first time to Smelly Cat was just the other day. I had heard lots of great things about this little coffee shop for quite some time and though i'd better check it out. Well I definitely was not disappointed! This is a real, authentic coffee shop with a great vibe and funky decorating. The woman at the counter kindly helped me decide on a soy dirty chai, something i've never had before but I put my trust in her! It was one of the greatest drinks i've ever had....the chai here is amazing, you must try it! Smelly Cat is a great place to study or just hang out, the staff are cool and friendly, and the coffee is beyond amazing.  Stop going to chains and try this place!

uQs0uoyeECJdxmSiWdvmyg.text: I'm a avid coffee drinker and the coffee quality and taste is very important. My lady told me about this place called Noda and Smell Cat popped up. With a list of great reviews I had too try it out. Starbucks can only thrill a coffee lover so much till we need a new unique taste. This place has a amazing ambience and atmosphere. You'll notice private tables and their coffee roaster right in the middle of the store. I've tried two of their blends, Black Cat being my favorite. I took a bag of LLorana home which was a little darker. Very good roasted coffee. I highly recommend. Only problem, too far from my house.

FHYL2m-knNVaIISRuMe0Dg.text: Absolutely amazing. Friendly staff, delicious coffee, delicious pastries, and a great experience. Honestly, we planned to just go in and sit down for maybe 5 minutes to have a cup of coffee, but we ended up staying and talking to Cathy for about 45 minutes. You can feel her passion for coffee and for her customers in the way she talks. She walked us through her entire roasting process and even let us taste the coffee beans! It's definitely a welcoming environment, unlike a lot of coffee shops that just want to get you through the line and out the door.   We had the cuban and cortadito, which were both delicious, and Cathy also gave us samples of both of their nitro cold brews. Having tried them before, I was completely against nitrogen-infused coffee, but theirs will change your mind! Both were very delicious and were infused with just the right amount of nitrogen, not over infused like other places that give it that almost beer-like taste.   If we lived around here, we would be in here every day!

cixz6NPGdHkF-M2Rjn1LSQ.text: A cute little spot hidden in NoDa. Love meeting friends here for coffee or just catching up on some laptop work here.

_poVVjRlH9Pz9d_SZ8hWIA.text: Nice little spot in NODA, could smell the fresh coffee from outside. Sat outside with the wife and drank a coconut frappe. Seating was nice and comfortable, inside was cozy. Everyone should visit Smelly Cat Coffee House!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. All gone!
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside the coffee house chillin&#39;

rTU-_GJipO10amTlSygDzQ.text: A number of good coffee houses in CLT but Smelly Cat my fav. NODA parking always a challenge but goes with the turf.

z_G1jhQTkS99bibvFNe1nA.text: Wonderful coffee and espresso, great staff and very down to earth. Barista's are friendly and have a passion for their art but are not egotistical which is rare. Wish there was more lighting and better seating but over all wonderful experience!

7qwmOyedqhkev8_z4vQ4_A.text: One of the best lattes I've ever had!  I love everything from the fact that I could get almond milk to the smell of the roasting beans they prepare on sight. The coffee Roast was obviously a perfected art here!

zNOkTWwf6HqprcT9bWCHxQ.text: Cute coffee house with good coffee. All drinks served in to go cups. I'm kind of picky but like my drink in glassware when I go out to places like this for coffee.

ipBOTNqJfihUZ1Hx0YfwWA.text: I normally stick to Starbucks but this place was a good change for fresh brewed Coffee and great snacks.

lImsXcLYhAwpKWjXiNv_TQ.text: The best. I buy their ground coffee to make at home as well. I always recommend it to people and it never disappoint. Dirty Chai is my favorite!

Aetbc3Popa5IJH-ijc2xHg.text: Went here on a quick trip to Charlotte and loved it. The atmosphere is welcoming and there is ample indoor and outdoor seating. The baristas were kind and knowledgeable, and my latte was tasty! If you are looking for a unique local coffee shop in Charlotte, this is your place!

-qTvoibz4r1ZEw6dV3vZcg.text: The owners were just as warm and welcoming as their coffee  I enjoy a nice almond milk latte and they were able to accommodate my desire. They make their flavored syrups in house, and boy were they a treat! I had the maple brown sugar as did my friend. She considered it to be the best coffee she'd ever tasted! The space was quaint and cozy, a great place to wake up and start the day! Overall, this was the perfect coffee house for our Charlotte visit.

c_by4edNzyzYQYC8jWhWSA.text: Trendy, but coffee leaves something to be desired. Location is good though and the decor is novel. Okay place, but way overhyped, I don't get it.

KS_KyphTgX4zUrR_vt3zEA.text: Am usually not a coffee person... but yest we had some time to while awa and tot vll check out this coffee shop...though the name doesn appeal at all, i must say for a change i enjoyed drinking coffee..ordered a cappuccino without any added flavor...it smelled good..and tasted nice!! also picked up their house made muffins...a craneberry orange muffin..it was delicious...actually pieces of fruit to bite on...i loved it. the ambience is also nice for some one to just sit and read or listen to some music while enjoying a good cup of coffee.

JrZB6NLC7GNtvGOAWwsa8A.text: Yummy coffee aromas greet you as you walk through the door along with a cheery hi. Service is knowledgeable and friendly.  The free WiFi is always appreciated though the space is a bit tight. Coffee and tea selections were good and prepared well. If more places around here were open for lunch I'd be here more often than I'd like. As it is I treat myself to their fast efficient service whenever I happen to be around the area in the daytime instead.  What's more could you ask for from a neighborhood coffee shop other than maybe an awesome name? Oh wait it's got that too!

6ASlx6Gjng4JBCM_YbNfgA.text: I rarely drink coffee, usually when I'm making a long distance drive.  But I've had tea several times at the Smelly Cat. Not bad. Nice too that they gave me more hot water when I was done and I was able to use my tea bag for another cup.  The dessert was good as well as the sliced sandwich wraps.  The cons:  I once visited on a day that someone's child was allowed free reign. Like, I saw him playing in the seating area then running behind the counter TOUCHING things, no hand washing apparent.   Um, no.  On my last visit -- which was my LAST visit -- there was a dog in the shop. Animals are lovely just not in a place where I'm paying to eat.  As a former pet owner, I know that even when animals are banned from the kitchen, animal FUR can never be banned from anywhere animals are allowed.  The hair floats on the smallest of breezes and deposits itself where ever it happens to land...

C1yo5TePtbGOWs-udQcd2g.text: Some of the best coffee I've ever had. The best coffee place in Charlotte and the Carolinas. Great vibe. Cool looking.

fiGPVAlhu3K01Zu0Wv9ugQ.text: Cozy space to hang out. I dropped in for some afternoon coffee before walking around the neighborhood to check out what NoDa has to offer.  I gave their Ethiopian brew a try but I wasn't too impressed. I noticed they have a pour over set up after buying a small coffee. Would have ordered a pour over if I had known!

ZWKhBp0V1oD78Ww1qTS2EA.text: Coffee selection is amazing!  I just wish they had as good of a selection of parking spots. We had to resort to street parking.  Once inside, the environment is quirky and eclectic.  The space was cozy, although at times felt a tad too small.  My friends and I went to Smelly Cat to work on a project.  As soon as we arrived, we realized that this wasn't the kind of coffee house you could be productive at.  Due to the size restrictions, which hence, make the table sizes smaller, we had to enjoy our delicious coffee and relocate.    Service was friendly and the atmosphere was super chill.  I'd go back for some schmooze time!

FeiDhmg8iPv4mIThgOQ2lw.text: The latte! Just wow. I'm in love with their homemade syrups! I mean the latte was FULL of flavor!! I'd didn't have to add ANYTHING! Can't wait to come back.

dGDTrPUDdrlQaJPuxbDvgA.text: Where NoDa wakes up. Excellent coffee. Nice outdoor seating. Wishing I'd come for cocktails last night.

Gks9SyjKKBG2Nv969Axg5w.text: Smelly Cat Coffee is cute, laid back, and open late! We love stopping in for a cappuccino and walking NoDa at night. The staff is friendly, and the coffee/espresso tastes great!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

0vabAn_6IWpZC9FgWQXpMA.text: Best coffee in NODA and in the top few in the city.  The shop is small and has a steampunk kind of vibe.  Nice outdoor seating on three sides of the building too.  Great coffee with a limited amount of pastries that are good if you want a bite to eat.  The farmers market takes place saturday mornings in their parking lot.  A coffee and some of the goods in the market make a wonderful start to the day.  The staff is really friendly and work quickly.  ***  I live in the middle of NODA and have been everywhere in the neighborhood many times over the past years. These reviews are a culmination of lots of visits so it's more of a consistency rating than anything.  If you are going out in NODA I've got reviews up of all the places in the neighborhood if you're looking to compare.  ***

2Yy033tDk-YAqykWdGcBMA.text: Nice coffee shop located in NODA. I had the iced dirty chai which was good. My husband had their Costa Rica pour over which he felt was ok. They roast their own beans. Seating is limited and an outlet was not working but other than that everything was clean and staff was nice!

ErKykhBbNtdpHPb5NOEsqQ.text: Cold brew coffee: 5/5  Chai Latte: 7/5  Zucchini bread: 5/5  This little place is dynamite! Definitely not your average Starbucks wannabe coffee shop. This place has an awesome vibe, a wide variety of pastries, muffins & treats baked in-house. Awesome products, and good prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chai latte &amp; Cold Brew Coffee

5cC8tyq_jeVjC7yJKteGVw.text: I was exploring the NODA area and came across this coffee shop on Yelp. The name stuck out as it reminded me of the show Friends so I decided to check it out. It's a quaint coffee shop that was conveniently located next to a small farmer's market. They offer three size options for hot coffee beverages - starting at 8 ounces. I ordered the Dirty Chai with almond milk. It is the best Dirty Chai I've had to date. The espresso didn't taste burnt and mixed well with the chai mix used. They also have a rewards program which is nice. I believe I was auto-enrolled when I swiped my credit card. If I am ever back in the area, I will be back!

85IYCdFHzkjBS3Fx1ZzPpQ.text: 4.5 stars What kind of coffee place doesn't recycle? Is this a new thing?  Recycling aside,  Smelly Cat was the perfect place for some caffeine fortification before the return leg of a road trip. Ended up with a frappe with an extra shot of espresso, and it was lovely and tasty. The dirty chai gets a lot of press, but I love my classics. Parking is free for two hours (put your receipt on the dash!)  I assume that this is named for Smelly Cat of Phoebe of Friends fame (maybe they should have Friends reruns playing? too blatant?), and it's a lovely little coffee shop with plenty of comfy seating and knick knacks and decor that you'd expect from a local little hipster-ish coffee shop. This is totally the kind of coffee shop I would hang out in to catch up with an old friend, or to solo write or read. Busy, cosy, but not too crazy.  Side note: They ran out of whipped cream while fixing my friend Kristen B's frappe and I was as put out as a five year old who doesn't get rainbow sprinkles on her sundae. However, they said I could come back for it in a few, and they totally did when I came back for it later!

aVnLZJLJdo6e0KSpNqOZiw.text: It's so difficult to find places that allow my baby Paris (maltipoo dog) in that serves fresh and tasty goodies. Exploring Charlotte I came across this cute spot and from the name I figured they would have no problem letting him in.  Cute outside seating, cozy rustic inside, and the customer service was top notch. Visited on a Sunday and it wasn't crazy busy but there were about 4 tables filled inside, while only 1 table, besides mine was taken outside. Ordered the iced Mojito Green Tea, and got too excited when I saw a gluten free peanut butter bar! Yesssss and it was OH SO DELICIOUS! Definitely the perfect spot for relaxing, getting work done, reading a book. This is not a place for a massive study group but stop in being 3 friends and order that peanut butter bar! I could've shared mine.... But naa =)

SSkRvW3E0gwc_n-qu_KvPA.text: Awesome coffee, the breakfast burrito was great and the comfortable ambience was lovely! Lots of friendly dogs!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

JfAkHnvtmcU5MZv1d9Td2g.text: I am a coffee connoisseur I drink nothing but lattes from different coffee houses Starbucks is one of my main ones Cafe Con Leche Cuban style it's another great one but when I had my first one from Smelly Cat Coffee OMG world's best world's best best latte around

Lyo7NSxVrKFABeujtrw6Lg.text: Fun little coffee shop. I was drawn to it by the name, and enjoyed my drinks at it. The parking is not fun around this area. I went during a not so busy time during the day, so there was room to sit inside and enjoy my drink. I have tried to go back since and have had no luck parking. Drinks were good and very well made. Bought my friend some coffee beans to make coffee at home, and they really enjoyed it.

Cq_nnSX8ty9oO9AnWr5Nzw.text: Best coffee is found in hipster coffeeshops and this is a great hipster coffeeshop!  They have free wifi which makes it great to study/get some work done. They have both indoor and outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cortado

5Zn_0QGldFP0wyl9-dghZw.text: I ordered a Dirty Chai here and my life has never been the same since. When I sip on my daily, straight forward and unimaginative iced coffee, distant memories of espresso, chai, almond milk and crushed ice still dance in my mind.   The truth is, I came here for the name. And because it was literally across the street from Yelp's Summertime Soiree at the Neighborhood Theatre across the street.  But boy am I glad they came up with a quirky name to hook and line me in there to experience that Dirty and take in the sights and scents of roasting coffee.

XJkHsgJyngABHU83nlEyQQ.text: Breakfast burrito was tasty and fresh! Coffee was a bit sour for my taste. Great atmosphere!

bS8F_E0hu9E3Ft0a8__i1w.text: One of my fav coffee places in Charlotte. You can smell the aroma right from their parking lot.  We ordered a cortado and cappuccino...good mix of coffee and music ... loved the ambience and the currency wall...found a note from my country :p Will definitely come again when in Noda

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. When in need of caffeine fix, head over to Smelly Cat and you won&#39;t be disappointed !

hgnuCYQBGITHGNmH-jIKNg.text: After living in Charlotte for over 10 years, I finally had coffee at Smelly Cat. Based on that one experience, I'd say 5 stars. The drip coffee was good, the cheddar and chive scone was good, the service was good. All in a all a good coffee shop experience. It's not super convenient to me and there's about 8,000 coffee shops between my house and this location. But if you're in the area, or just curious to check it out, go for it!

mva8xuFlsXs0ry0rgcZz2g.text: Pretty awesome place!!  The coffee is great!!  I had the iced toasted coconut latte!!  The flavor was great and it gave me the kick I needed!  The service was also very nice!  I'm definitely going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

aTGbvcBmZZkx8DF4OohH1g.text: Loved this place so much that I bought a sweatshirt! They have amazing cold brew and a great, cozy atmosphere! Around the building is a lot of neat street art that it necessary to check out. They're quick and their cold brew is amazing!

mT-vWTscErqpLUNXbsvBbA.text: The coffee shop is the only shop in town that offers their own roasting on premises. They have a giant contraption that they roast the green beans into what you're used to putting in your coffee grinder.  The coffee was delicious, a citrus raspberry taste with a light roast.  They also offered plenty of samples of their baked goods, which tasted amazing. I was happy to see that they offer real milk and cream, instead of the non-dairy creamer stuff.  There were plenty of places to sit and relax, play one of their games, or read one of their books. They offered lots of free literature at the front and back of the bar.  The staff was very welcoming and friendly, and the prices were quite reasonable for the high quality of coffees they're serving.

PAiHfWHpwx_Pm6uWKpnmZg.text: Trendy little shop with great coffee and awesome atmosphere.  I'm a big fan of the iced llorona on tap however, sometimes there are out but I can easily find a replacement cup of Joe.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

X_HCL01Q8cfLxAm8egLTyA.text: One of the staples of NoDa that I finally got around to checking out this morning. I was in the neighborhood looking at a house and figured I would swing by on this beautiful day, get a coffee, and do some reading! I did not get adventurous on my selection, just a regular latte, but when the latte is delicious there is no need to get experimental.  The inside is very cozy with some small tables for 2-4 people and some comfy chairs as well. Like I mentioned, I sat outside where there is also a lot of seating (probably more than inside). You can always tell the popularity of a place by the audience they serve. All sorts of people went in and out of Smelly Cat in the time I was there, and I loved it. Nothing brings people together like coffee!

5v4T25cfak3P-0-7FY9Yvg.text: Not my cup of tea. I get tea lattes and it blows my mind how unfamiliar some coffee places are with these. Anyway, I ordered, super nice people and all, but the tea latte wasn't that great. It was like warm when I got it which I don't know how since I got it straight away, and there was like, zero foam. What's a latte without foam? They also don't have stevia or my lesser choice, Splenda. My husband got the vanilla cappuccino. It was good, but very sweet. You know, sometimes you get a cappuccino more espresso tasting, and others more sweet? Well this one was the latter. The hubby was also treated to their fruity pebbles marshmallow treat. I'm not a fan of rice crispy treats, but I am a fan of fruity pebbles! This was a chunk of sugar rush that did not let me down! As the name suggests, there is something dying in there. It smells bad of you get the whiff. I don't like it. It's a cool, funky spot though to hang out and you can't be in there without thinking about Friends.

gwrGF1obRet5YNn7cgRHTA.text: This is such a nice little spot to drop in on. The workers are very friendly and the atmosphere was delightful. We had the breakfast burritos which were super and the coffee brewed to perfection.

2h2SzHdabwAmbPflZp8Mjw.text: Went here because it was suggested to me from my cousins (who know I'm obsessed with FRIENDS) and I've been here at least 10 times in the past 4 years. Their coffee is good and they make a mean Chai Tea Latte! So good! Also their peanut butter brownie is amazing!!'

Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pics from outside
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pics from outside

UVehDC1WOuWAte3uQRSLKg.text: Staple coffee place for NoDa. They have some of the best coffee (and really good apple cider) in Charlotte. The staff here is always really friendly and helpful.  Inside the coffee show is pretty cozy. They have a few tables, some nooks if you want to be secluded or some comfy chairs. There's not a lot of seating inside, but there's more on the outside.   Great place to grab a coffee and get some work done (free wifi of course) !

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

cUpPBB5tn9QT77z0I2HJkw.text: Amazing service. Amazing drinks. Highly recommend it. Loved the drinks and games and it was a great place to hang out

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

eJa6ZHmK7rZgzHVgxFHaow.text: Unique. The decorations of cats inside the place really pay tribute to the name. The baristas were all very friendly and warm. It's a bit dark and small inside but they provide great seating outside if that isn't your scene.  They gave me quick service and my cubano was delicious.  The area is very cute with several other places to walk around and shop.  They also had wonderful baked goods for sale   They have a good amount of seating :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside

GJ8kccSDucUEWdMrGLyMrA.text: Smelly Cat Coffee is a cool hip spot in the heart of NoDa!  Great service & environment! I ordered a cortadito and although it wasn't exactly what I'd get back in Miami, it was a good try and tasted great! I also ordered an apple muffin which was the PERFECT morning snack to go along with the espresso. Although I was only there for 20 minutes, the vibe and atmosphere is very welcoming and the perfect spot to read, study, chat and get your morning going. Right in the back of the Cafe, they have a small market on Saturdays which you can check out after you're done. It was definitely a cool spot filled with locals.

Pr2O0Yft8z1BqXIz0ZZf_Q.text: This is my Friday morning coffee shop review.  I got a vanilla latte that was almost room temperature.  Flavor was good but this was supposed to be a hot beverage. I got to the parking lot and should have went back in to complain. I will be honest here!!!. Why? Why should I have to complain? How hard is it to make a latte, it is a coffee shop. All the empty beer bottles outside of this place maybe I should have had one of those. Will not be back.

EWleKf0Q0tKZ-0oGPCgeJg.text: The best part of this place is the decor. Their coffee, I've heard (from coffee loving friends) that it was not good. But personally I'm a Chai tea lover, and their chai tea is very very bad. It's powder based and very bad. But it has a cool vibe, I'd probably go for a tea (can't go wrong with hot water and a tea bag).

XHdsK0U0AxSgX3XA0PYI1g.text: Love the vibe here, enjoy a hot drink, hanging out with friend, meeting with new people!

ejXu95zztrN1ykuZLXzzlg.text: They have good coffee that is undoubtable, but the interior is not set up for an ergonomic study area. The seats are hard and uncomfortable, the place is too dark (think throwback to 2000's Abercrombie dark), and the music is unbearably loud. Stopped in after hearing so many good things from people, but definitely not a convert. Might be great to grab a cup of Coffee and talk with a friend, but go elsewhere if you are trying to get work done.

wgM7t613VywfiXrB46mQ9g.text: I am still not sure if this coffee shop is an ode to Phoebe from Friends or not- but I can't help but sing her song in my head every time I walk through the door.  Their staff are always so friendly, like family, really. From bold roasts to teas, it's all top notch.  Post up in one of their booth nooks, perfect for the remote worker; grab a seat in the red chairs out front and enjoy some sunshine, or snatch a table table at the bar and spectate the people walking by.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

S1I9oix6NDYtdknV1acbjw.text: Won't bother with this place ever again. Over it. Asked for light ice because the first time I ordered an iced chai it was packed with ice and very little chai. Same BS. $4.75 cup of ice. Expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Don&#39;t bother asking for light ice. No Fs given from the baristas. Go to Amélie&#39;s instead.

H-PtQBCqZww-PSROSm-ugQ.text: Great service and great advice on different types of cold brew. Great a selection of coffee and cold brews.

rVQ9nhbnvrbaWBcA2TxJ5A.text: I used to spend many a day here during my first two years as new Charlotte resident but Sunday was my first time back in about a year. I can't remember what I used to order all those times but I am now a fan of their ever-popular iced dirty chai latte (with almond milk). Is it too far of a stretch for me to say that Smelly Cat is pretty close to being considered hipster-ish?    In my experience, the employees are and always have been very knowledgeable and willing to break down any and all aspects of a drink. I've found that it's easier to ask about certain things than relying on the menu that's posted. Availability of some things change plus they're usually adding food items. On Sunday morning when I visited, they had scones, muffins, sausage/bacon & egg biscuits, and bagels - all made in-house. Maybe because it's the South, but I just don't see the need for a coffee shop to sell biscuit sandwiches. I skipped the food this time and happily sucked down my drink.  The dirty chai latte was/is delicious!!! The medium was $5.71 but I don't think it's that much more than what you would pay for the same drink at Starbucks. I loved that they prepared it with crushed ice and there was no need for any additional sweetener. The chai spice they use settles down at the bottom so be sure to give your drink a good shake before you take your first sip.  There are so many different drinks and coffee concoctions they that I look forward to continuing to drink my way around their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. When summer beckons, smelly cat&#39;s iced dirty chai latte will answer the call.

eVP9_r9H4ltraEkEuLbvEg.text: Cool location and the best cup of coffee on our trip. Cool shirt and mug bought there too, but a bit pricey for the swag though.  Gal ringing us up was very apathetic, but that was her and didn't affect the product one bit.   Would definitely come back if passing through again.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

mllHXQSyt05wLGNSjPVHcA.text: Good coffee in CLT happy with my plain iced americano. Neat scene to sit down and catch up with friends. Quaint small coffee joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

CECxDp4hJi1IY1s73DGF3A.text: Pretty good, nice and quiet place. A bit small and crowded but it adds to the ambience and aesthetics if that's your sort of thing. The coffee is decent, some are better than others. It's not a Starbucks type of thing. Strong black coffee and maybe some fancy mixed coffees here and there.

oyS7TYE49kITfipyaP624g.text: Great iced chai latte.  Love the atmosphere of this place... very cozy and personal.  The artwork on the walls and also all the fllyers of the "what's happening" in the NoDa scene are great conversation starters as well as just keeping up with the local art scene.  In my last visit I noticed chess boards and checkers on the shelf which you can play with... not plastic/cheapo sets, but sets with character... wood with metal pieces.  I bet there are more games, but I only saw these in passing.  Staff was super friendly and my latte was unique tasting (in a good way).

iEaZkUTiSIfNDWENvi-Eaw.text: Overall, I think supporting local business is among my top priorities. Which is why I continue to get coffee here when I can. Plus I really like the owners and their approach to being innovative in their business. But overall, it's not my favorite - the value of what you're getting compared to the cost always seems to be out of whack. The smell of the beans roasting is an instant no for me - I love the smell of coffee roasting, but this doesn't smell like coffee. Worst offense for me, though, is the parking situation - I will never understand how all the spaces are full, but no one is actually in the place. If I can't find parking, I usually just drive somewhere else.

pv7yNEJ-g4hseiaHC9uXAA.text: Best coffee in the Queen City, hands down. I love coming here early in the morning, never once will you meet a rude barista in this coffee house. The staff are always so friendly and perky. Watching them roast the beans in front of you is always a treat.

-sF-LDokhogNI3HOA3jmCQ.text: I've been digging on Smelly Cat for about a decade now. It's a fun little spot and it's nice to see how they've grown and changed over the years. I love that they now offer "real food" that they make in house, meaning I can get breakfast, lunch, and light supper items there in addition to their pastries. One big difference compared to some mom and pop coffee places in the city is that they make their own syrups. I'm IN LOVE with the coconut syrup! The only challenges I've ever had are finding a (good) table [it's very small and popular location so space is at a premium, especially if it's too cold or hot to sit outside] and parking.   In Summary: + Fantastic Coffee!!! + Friendly staff/Good Service + Okay pastry/ Good Veggie Chili! + Vegan/Vegetarian Friendly + Quaint eclectic atmosphere (although very small) - Parking challenges

vqZGqx6dNBpNY4BSGxtqmA.text: When you want to stick it to the man (Starbucks) this is definitely a great option. The staff is friendly and almost all of them live locally so they're enjoyable to chat with and simply be around.  They recently have begun roasting their own coffee beans which adds a freshness and death to the coffee like I have never experienced before.   Don't forget that they also offer wine and beer as well as a discount for beer when you check in with yelp.  However, the selling point for me is definitely that they except Square... So load them up in your Square Wallet and put it on your tab so you can feel like you're already a regular your first time visiting.

wICyVk7rU1a4Fl9BgOzNAA.text: Naturally when I even think of Smelly Cat, I want to sing the Phoebe Buffay song from 'Friends'..."smelly cat, oh smelly cat, what are they feeding you?" HA, just like you Nicole (I just read your review)! :D Smelly Cat is always busy...which is a good thing! I've walked here many a time (from further down N Davidson St). Love that they have indoor & outdoor seating; however, on a nice day, you'll see everyone wants to be out on the patio. No Da is the perfect place for this coffeehouse. I go with the Hazelnut coffee each time & it's yummy!

iIUJNK6NfpSMaitO71zYRg.text: I stopped by this coffee house to get some work done. They were unable to make pour overs at the time of my visit, so I ordered a cafe au lait. The coffee was ok, the setting was cute, and they blasted 80's music the entire time I was there. I liked that this place has plenty of parking spaces, free wifi, and plenty of tables/chairs to get work done indoors or outdoors!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cafe au lait!

eB11naPM1jDIuNR49SRygg.text: My neighborhood favorite! Smelly Cat is the bomb! Every time I walk into this NoDa gem a smile instantly crosses my face. From the delicious Almond Milk Chai Latte (yes they have almond milk) to the awesome service of Miss Frankie & Miss Leah, there is never a time where Smelly Cat does make my day.  Thanks for the yummy caffeine and sorry for all the times that Torrie (of #thesavageway) and I rearrange your tables for work! :)

kYsYAW3sXqeVJLeqIWI5Mg.text: My go-to place for my morning pick me up when I work in the neighborhood. Coffee is always fresh, they have almond milk (which is a big plus from someone who doesn't drink soy) and the staff is always super friendly and welcoming. The bagels and their herb cream cheese are made in house and are to die for. If you're in the area, definitely worth the try.

7UAv4y9bs9Uy6JCwC3Xe5w.text: This place is still amazing. I am writing this as an update. I have been coming here for almost 3 years and it still never gets old. I just wanted to mention the new roaster. They roast their own COFFEE!!!!!!!!! This is such an amazing thing for a small coffee shop to have. It is such a creative niche. The quality of their coffee is the best in Charlotte. HAND DOWN!!!!.   My favorite still is the dirty chai.   I would like to mention something weird about this place which makes it very special. I applied to work here right before the DNC, and I got past the first interview. They told me that I would have to sign a contract that I would be able to work for at least a year in order to get the job. Due to being a college student, I couldn't get tied down for a year, but I love that they want their employees to stay for at least a year so that they gain a bond with the customers. I would love to work for a company/business like this in the future.   There is also talk about getting their own bakery area. They are going to make all their baked goods in house. This place is going to be around for a long time.

Wcy1Yzppn64m5KC7CQmyZA.text: Great neighborhood coffee shop with delicious coffee and treats. Very cozy vibe and friendly staff. They have breakfast sandwiches now too.

5FBuE8-BiHSULF24pPn1Tw.text: Cute as a button tucked into the pocket of the heart of NoDa, and full of the quirky but laissez-fare vibe that makes the neighborhood so special.  I mean, where else can you come in for espresso and sit next to a neighbor's dog curled against a booth and lazily awaiting its owner's return?  Where else can you have chocolate truffles and coffee (a combination that needs to proliferate, in my humble view)?  Look, this little nook of a shop makes a good brew and has plenty of tempting eats to nosh on.  If you want to step away from the big chains and get to know your local shops and the neighbors, the Cat fits that bill.  Baristas know the regulars and if you will just talk to them, they will make your drink to fit your preferences too.  If it's not, tell them and they'll remake it.    The wife and I like coming here if for no other reason than each trip is an experience- interesting people, interesting sights, and it feels like we find something new to try every time.  I recommend it to anyone who visits and encourage locals to go and support a local business doing it all right.  Like their Facebook page for notices of upcoming events and special products (not to mention a list of that days fresh brews).

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

30yQjGqyEo_hNIwCWSvdJQ.text: Good local coffee shop where they roast their coffee. My fave is New Orleans cold brew with cream.. Had a good time "hangout" with the owner during Charlotte Coffee Crawl event.. Definitely a coffee shop you need to stop when you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Orleans cold brew is one of my favorite

r_2p8Y03fUQ-tbIoVj14oA.text: Bar none, this is my favorite Coffee house in the Charlotte metro area. They capture the neighborhood feel of NoDa perfectly. Having recently moved out of the area the one thing that I miss THE most are my daily trips to Smelly Cat.  I have been coming here for many years and I have to say that the group of people that work here are amazing. Forgive me if I misspell  anyone's name....Tony seems to have the roasting business mastered as he roasts all of their beans in house. Not only do I go for a cup daily but I also buy all of my beans for home from here. Tony really influenced my love for this place as he immediately learned my name , my favorite type of roast and it felt to me like each time I stepped in the door that I received amazing service from him. This stretches throughout all of the staff ( the Rachels are the same, super attentive , wonderfully kind and they go out of their way to make my visits great). On top of this the owner is a frequent face within Smelly Cat and within the local NoDa community. She is as pleasant as anyone I have met and I can tell that she has put her stamp on the culture of this business. I sometimes wonder how they are able to keep such a quality staff of people as you don't find this within many businesses, it clearly stands out!   I will be ordering all of my beans on line from now on and I have already figured out a away to steer my workday through NoDa a couple times a week just so I can still enjoy my favorite spot. The atmosphere is great, the staff are great and the coffee is great...thanks Smelly Cat crew!!!  -Cameron

NIohzAQlM-QBWTvUjhOzMg.text: Just got tea but it was awesome! Love the vibes and friendliness of the staff. Kind of lost walking in but they were very patient and helped walk me through their offerings.

m4VfqTgull8hhpB5OYIcOQ.text: I absolutely adore this little coffee shop. After drinking their vanilla lattes I would pick this over Starbucks anyday! All if the staff are such sweethearts and super quirky and fun, it is in such a good location in NoDa. It's one of my favorite places to go just to type up a paper and have a coffee or chi tea.

lEzLrRikue058mdA-4-5Dw.text: Love this place so so much!  From their pastries, to their hot chocolate & coffees!  The ambiance is also something unique and amazing. I love quirky little coffee houses, an my only wish was that it was closer to me!  The service is always great & the coffee comes out quick without the taste being compromised.  Definitely a place I'll drive almost 30 min to, just for the coffee. Yum!

b3mVR5RWTlZRvIIAfcnmgA.text: This was a great place to stop for coffee while visiting Charlotte. The owner stopped to chat with us and showed us the coffee roaster. Overall very friendly atmosphere and great coffee. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee roaster in the middle of the room so customers can see how they roast their own beans

4m0cVIOSA5v-qX-6d9xi7A.text: I walked in here after strolling around Noda waiting for lunch time at Cabo Fish Taco. With no line, I decided to order an iced chai - medium. Normally I get 2% milk, but I wasn't sure if they carried, whole, skim, etc. so I asked. They have several different kinds, but what I settled on was Almond milk. It was my first time trying out this combo, and it was delicious! Definitely hit the spot on a warm day, and is now my new favorite drink. Better yet, it was less than $5.

0N1ytQbdcgqRnFH5umY-0w.text: A nice place to sit outside and people watch. Had the dirty chai and would return again for that. The chai was a nice blend not candy sweet.

bZDIApS3u42cKDIl7Vo0UQ.text: A nice little hangout if it's a nice day and you just want to chill and have a cup of coffee.

ZXzLP-h2YlbfgT6mIViOqg.text: I've been wanting to try Smelly Cat for a while now and unfortunately it didn't live up to my expectations.  I'm hoping I just caught this place on a bad night.  It was very slow (only 2 other customers in the place) and there was only one person working.  I ordered my standby, a skinny mocha, and was disappointed.  It barely had any coffee flavor and just didn't taste right for a mocha.  I also tried out one of the delicious-looking chocolate cupcakes which turned out to be just ok.  I'm starting to wonder if cupcakes just aren't my thing.  The part of the visit that makes me want to come back is the cozy and quirky atmosphere.  The decor is really cool with old rustic doors that section off seating areas and plenty of local artwork on the walls.  Although most of the tables I saw during my visit were dirty I have a feeling it isn't always this way.  I want to come back with my laptop or kindle, grab a cup of coffee and stay for a while to see if this place grows on me.

DVGrAfqdVwWJcaUFP7Cu3A.text: I was hanging out in NODA a couple of times listening to music, drum circles and heard this one man band inside smelly cat. Of course if you have watched Friends, you know Fibi and her song. So this man had his knees strapped with symbols, hands on his guitar, Mic with a harmonica, and feet tapping on the drums below. He could sing too. Coffee was great. Many flavors, I think there were scones. Cozy walk up place. Noda is all park and walk around.

F-1_Ztu96P9GwkXn0x_T9Q.text: Great place to chill on the patio. Good location makes it easy for a casual morning walk to enjoy coffee.

naG2tuSBM1nazSzyvWVKpg.text: Smelly Cat is an awesome NoDa hangout. The artsy decor includes doors that have been placed to create little nooks for several of the tables.  They offer free wireless and plenty of coffee drinks and snacks. I typically get a chai latte, but if you're looking for more of a dessert, the chai shake is really good too. I love sitting outside reading a book and enjoying a coffee on a nice day.

photos.caption: Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Smelly Cat Coffee - Charlotte, NC, United States

Yy3nvCJ4ly3A98a47SL6JQ.text: I love how customer service oriented this place is. I went in last thursday and they were having a wine tasting later in the evening. I ended up recieving a complimentory truffle to account holders. It was a sweet gesture and the truffle was really pleasent.   Their flavor of the day roast that they have been doing ::Pumpkin Spice:: is absolutely a hit with me. The flavors dont taste at all artificial and it is so season appropiate. I love their Kona and Guatamalan blends they occasionally have.   Great Coffee shop, wonderful place to chat the day away.

jA6UXbI4VSI4UUmTvKeybA.text: Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat thanks for providing me with a comfy booth and tasty treats. And yes, I'm that tool who sings the Smelly Cat song in my head every single time I walk into this cute little coffee house.   Smelly Cat is one of those adorable local coffee hangouts that is chock full of fun. They have coffee, they have ice cream, they have pastries, they have tea...I mean, comon' they even have cheesecake. The staff have always been really friendly and eager to please. Hubs and I have strolled in here a few times during Friday gallery crawls and have yet to be disappointed.   I've enjoyed a very good, and very sweet, white mocha. No doubt it would put most folks straight into sugar shock. On another occasion I've taken down a hefty strawberry croissant. While it wasn't at the caliber of other local bakeries, it was still flaky and scrumptious. I also remember a time that I enjoyed some type of mango iced tea. Even unsweetened it was the perfect accompaniment to a sweltering summer day.   Until next time, Smelly Cat, I'm going to try to get this song out of my head now.

zcccQ4rBBq-5ZyYIusU6NA.text: Just sitting here getting ready to leave. I came here to get out of the house to study -- however this is not the spot (well for me). Having a lot of technical terminology to learn - the distractions here were  worse than my dogs.   But for a coffee shop to chill and surf the web --- this is a great place. The music selection overhead was perfect, the ambiance is cozy, the counter staff professional and with smiles.   I ordered a non-fat cap and it was velvety, smooth, and delish. The beans they use are roasted to perfection.   I will have to check out the Smelly Cat again when my brain is not required.   Thanks for the Java Jolt Smelly Cat!

JlGosKDSe9IQJbzkHiqIpA.text: By far the best customer service I've ever had..hands down.  My husband and I went here for the first time today after I had heard some great things about this coffee shop.  I ordered the iced dirty chai latte which they are known for.  I personally wasn't a fan of it..there was some sort of spice in there that didn't agree with me.  I want to note that many many people LOVE this drink so I encourage you to still try it even though I didn't care for it.  I don't believe it was anything they did wrong it just was not my personal favorite.  I was a little nervous to ask for my money back but figured I'd at least ask since I knew I wasn't going to be able to drink it.  Cathy (the owner) was extremely nice.  She asked if they could remake it for me or if I wanted to try something else on top of her giving my money back for the drink..I told her that was okay (I already felt bad for returning the drink!). Then on top of that she encouraged me to come back and try something else and the drink would be on the house.  I've never received such great customer service and encourage anyone to give this place a try.  The next time I'm in the area I will try a different drink.  They also roast their own coffee and offer almond and soy milk which I appreciate since dairy milk does not agree with my stomach.  Terrific owner!

H_l3Okb4P-ij2euaQZ1ikw.text: I was passing through Charlotte again and decided to pay another visit to the Cat.  My first review (which I would urge you to read for the humor alone) documented Lattegate.  They have pretty baristas here - today the beauty of the barista split me down the middle like a battleaxe.  Yes, I just compared being struck by beauty to being split with a battleaxe.  I wonder if that is "awesome" or not.  Some choose Cupid - I apparently choose Viking imagery.  Anyway, this time I ordered your regular ol' coffee and realized that the beans are from Dilworth.  Dilworth is a place that I absolutely savaged in a Yelp review because I felt that it wasn't what it was advertised to be, but you'll note that I never had a problem with the beans, which is an arena where Dilworth truly does a good job.  I'm glad that Smelly Cat is sourcing beans from a local, high quality roaster.    The cup was great; I then realized that there was a wine rack on the wall.  Malbec, what what?  Yes please.  I must have missed this aspect of Smelly Cat before.  They had a malbec from Argentina that was very tasty.  This is one of the grape varietals used in production of Bordeaux within France and is popularly grown in Argentina - I am digging malbec these days.  I followed up my coffee and wine by bashfully approaching the barista to ask about the wifi.  It's a password-protected wifi system.  In the end, Smelly Cat is my home base in Charlotte as far as coffee is concerned.  As long as life keeps dragging me through Charlotte I'll be stopping by.

r2J-gBEDl0wbicxHBXN39A.text: I love a cozy, funky coffee shop, and this is one. The kind of place you just want to hang out in all afternoon. Even though I don't live in Charlotte, it felt like a friend was going to just come walking up to chat.  The pumpkin cake was yummy with all the cream cheese, perfect with afternoon coffee.

IT61ayixuszistkJdIoOqA.text: We love the Smelly Cat! The antique rustic atmosphere is very hip and the employees are extremely helpful. We tried there version of a frap and loved it. Once weekly we drive forty five minutes to the cat house and find it very relaxing.

Jf9tiSQs99zMNERu93FwcA.text: A lovely place. Great coffee, especially the cold brew! The staff is always delightful and friendly. Love the outdoor seating.  The inside is cozy and they play good music. This is definitely my favorite little spot to relax in Charlotte.

ubujtgdk53ktQ2idJKKK2A.text: There was an intermittent alternate dimension happening at Smelly Cat over the past couple of days, and it made for great people watching. Case in point: today several groups of fourth graders paraded in throughout the day to read their own poetry, open-mic style. It was quite the site to see, what with all of the rhyming prose and the enraptured listening of the teaching set, and when it was over? Snaps, just like the beats like it. Ginsberg might have been confused, but he might have been proud.  Smelly Cat Coffee House is just what the name implies, a cozy cove of fluffy chairs, enclaves, and cafe tables that make camping out here in NoDa fun. My meetings today flew by, not the least of which was because of the hazelnut Italian soda I slammed, or the arty ramblings of children, or the giant leafblower that careened about when I sat outside for a bit. It's a little on the small side, but you don't have to be gigantic to be a cool coffee room. And as it turns out, if you're here, the ability to snap effectively helps.

BS8ZJunGSTmdKGhYHapu7w.text: My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. Artsy feel, friendly baristas, and a great place to relax, have a conversation, or study. So good. My personal favorites are: Mocha Frappe, Caramel Apple Cider, Toasted Coconut Frappe, and the various teas Smelly Cat offers.

EKJRV32sIAoAi8V6b_uSCw.text: Phenomenal coffee and amazing people.  Coffee roasted in house and real, friendly people.

ooHk4OKw-mvwn6LdKDzzVQ.text: Top notch coffee and fantastic baristas! They roast all their own coffee in-house and do a great job. I thought decaf and cold brew coffee were both sacrilege, until I tried the Peruvian (get it as a pour over, Leah knows her shit!), Snickerdoodle, and Hazelnut. Also, just try a pour over with any of the roasts, it'll open your eyes to a whole new level of coffee goodness!

tNgr3lKFw6m-1zmykZ3Bbg.text: Always a great experience at this wonderful mom and pop coffeehouse.  The baristas are all very friendly and the drinks are great.  I am a big fan of the iced Sweet New Orleans and the Chai tea. Also, it is hard to make a visit there without a slice of the Zucchini bread; it is so delicious.

e7bZe1xVQrglwdsg7B8JCw.text: I visited Smelly Cat Coffee house recently and had a great experience.  I ordered an iced chai latte with almond milk which was creamy and packed plenty of flavor.  Just the right amount of spices.  As noted by another yelper, the crushed ice was a welcomed surprise.  The coffee shop is cute with indoor and outdoor seating.  The baristas are friendly and free parking is always a plus!

Eazl5PC5RjWyK3U5wCe4uQ.text: Pretty sure if I lived in Charlotte I would spend a lot of time here.  Just walking through the door made me smile.    All around friendly staff, yielding friendly patrons, drinking smooth, rich coffee, eating totally passable baked goods and just all-around putting out some positive coffee house energy.    If you lived here, you'd be home now
